member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.BulkDownloadOperation
member.summary: Represents a bulk download operation requested by a user. You can use this class to poll for the download status, and then download the file when available.
member.example: The method returns an instance of this class. If for any reason you do not want to wait for the file to be prepared for download, for example if your application quits unexpectedly or you have other tasks to process, you can use an instance of to download the file when it is available.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.BulkOperation`1

member.summary: Provides high level methods for uploading and downloading entities using the Bulk API functionality. Also provides methods for submitting upload or download operations.
member.remarks: will submit the download request to the bulk service, poll until the status is completed (or returns an error), and downloads the file locally. member.summary: The extension type of the downloaded file. For possible values, see DownloadFileType Value Set at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511672.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadParameters.CampaignIds
member.summary: The campaigns to download. You can specify a maximum of 1,000 campaigns. The campaigns that you specify must belong to the same account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadParameters.LastSyncTimeInUTC
member.summary: The last time that you requested a download. The date and time is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Typically, you request a full download the first time you call the operation by setting this element to null. On all subsequent calls you set the last sync time to the time stamp of the previous download. The download file contains the time stamp of the download in the SyncTime column of the Account record. Use the time stamp to set LastSyncTimeInUTC the next time that you request a download. If you specify the last sync time, only those entities that have changed (been updated or deleted) since the specified date and time will be downloaded. However, if the campaign data has not been previously downloaded, the operation performs a full download.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadParameters.PerformanceStatsDateRange
member.summary: The date range values for the requested performance data in a bulk download. For possible values, see PerformanceStatsDateRange Data Object at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511673.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadStatus.Completed
member.summary: The download completed successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadStatus.InProgress
member.summary: The download is in progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadStatus.Failed
member.summary: The download failed. You may submit a new download with fewer entities, without performance data, or try again to submit the same download later.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadStatus.FailedFullSyncRequired
member.summary: The last sync time must be null. The request's LastSyncTimeInUTC element must be set to null if the specified account was included in a data migration, for example the URL by match type migration. After requesting a full download, you may begin requesting delta downloads again.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.Entities.BulkCampaignAgeTarget
member.summary: Represents an age target that is associated with a campaign. The age target contains one or more age target bids. This class exposes the property that can be read and written as fields of the Campaign Age Target record in a bulk file.

remarks.para: One exposes a read only list of . Each instance corresponds to one Campaign Age Target record in the bulk file. If you upload a , then you are effectively replacing any existing bids for the corresponding age target.
For more information, see Campaign Age Target at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=511530.

summary.para: Represents a target that is associated with an ad group. The target contains one or more sub targets, including age, gender, day and time, device OS, and location. Each target can be read or written in a bulk file.

remarks.para: When requesting downloaded entities of type , the results will include Ad Group Age Target, Ad Group DayTime Target, Ad Group DeviceOS Target, Ad Group Gender Target, Ad Group Location Target, Ad Group Negative Location Target, and Ad Group Radius Target records. For more information, see Bulk File Schema at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=511639.
For upload you must set the object, which will effectively replace any existing bids for the corresponding target.

member.summary: The campaigns to download. You can specify a maximum of 1,000 campaigns. The campaigns that you specify must belong to the same account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.SubmitDownloadParameters.LastSyncTimeInUTC
member.summary: The last time that you requested a download. The date and time is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Typically, you request a full download the first time you call the operation by setting this element to null. On all subsequent calls you set the last sync time to the time stamp of the previous download. The download file contains the time stamp of the download in the SyncTime column of the Account record. Use the time stamp to set LastSyncTimeInUTC the next time that you request a download. If you specify the last sync time, only those entities that have changed (been updated or deleted) since the specified date and time will be downloaded. However, if the campaign data has not been previously downloaded, the operation performs a full download.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.SubmitDownloadParameters.PerformanceStatsDateRange
member.summary: The date range values for the requested performance data in a bulk download. For possible values, see PerformanceStatsDateRange Data Object at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511673.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Internal.OAuthWithAuthorizationCode
member.summary: Represents a proxy to the Microsoft account authorization service. Implement an extension of this class in compliance with the authorization code grant flow for Managing User Authentication with OAuth documented at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=511609. This is a standard OAuth 2.0 flow and is defined in detail in the Authorization Code Grant section of the OAuth 2.0 spec at http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-15#section-4.1. For more information about registering a Bing Ads application, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=511607.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Internal.OAuthAuthorization
member.summary: The abstract base class for all OAuth authentication classes. You can use this class to dynamically instantiate a derived OAuth authentication class at run time. This class cannot be instantiated, and instead you should use either , , or , which extend this class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Authentication
member.summary: The abstract base class for all authentication classes.
member.example: sets the AuthenticationToken header element for the corresponding service client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Authentication.SetAuthenticationFieldsOnApiRequestObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the required SOAP header elements for the corresponding Bing Ads service operation.
member.param: The Bing Ads service operation request object. For example, this object can be the GetUserRequest message of the GetUser service operation. For more information about GetUser, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=511603.
member.remarks: The header elements that the method sets will differ depending on the type of authentication. For example if you use one of the OAuth classes, the AuthenticationToken header will be set by this method, whereas the UserName and Password headers will remain empty.

member.summary: Adds the required http headers elements for the corresponding bulk file upload operation.
member.param: The headers collection to which authentication requests should be added.
member.remarks: The header elements that the method sets will differ depending on the type of authentication. For example if you use one of the OAuth classes, the AuthenticationToken header will be set by this method, whereas the UserName and Password headers will remain empty.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Internal.OAuthAuthorization.SetAuthenticationFieldsOnApiRequestObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the AuthenticationToken header element for the corresponding Bing Ads service operation.
member.param: The Bing Ads service operation request object.

remarks.para: This method will set the OAuth access token as the AuthenticationToken header on the API request object.
For example, object can be the GetUserRequest message of the GetUser service operation. For more information about GetUser, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=511603.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Internal.OAuthWithAuthorizationCode.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the OAuthWithAuthorizationCode class.
member.param: The client identifier corresponding to your registered application.
The client secret corresponding to your registered application, or null if your app is a desktop or mobile app.
The URI to which the user of the app will be redirected after receiving user consent.
The refresh token that should be used to request an access token.

remarks.para: For more information about using a client identifier for authentication, see the Client Password Authentication section of the OAuth 2.0 spec at http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-15#section-3.1

For web applications, redirectionUri must be within the same domain of your registered application. For more information, see the Redirection Uri section of the OAuth 2.0 spec at http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-15#section-2.1.1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.ServiceClient`1.CallAsync``2(System.Func{`0,``0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``1}},``0)
member.summary: Calls the Bing Ads service and returns the response of the corresponding of the Bing Ads service.
member.typeparam: The type of the Bing Ads service request message.
The type of the Bing Ads service response message.
member.param: A delegate representing the Bing Ads service operation that should be called.
The request message object for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result will be the Bing Ads service response.

remarks.para: The header elements that the method sets will differ depending on the type of authentication specified in and the requirements of the service. For example if you use one of the OAuth classes, the AuthenticationToken will be set by this method, whereas the UserName and Password headers will remain empty. Some services such as Customer Management do not accept CustomerId and CustomerAccountId headers, so they will be ignored if you specified them in the object.

If you are using one of the OAuth classes for authentication and the access token has expired (error 109 is returned from the API), this method will try to refresh it using the current refresh token and retry the request with the new access token.

member.exception: Thrown if a fault is returned from the Bing Ads service.
Thrown if tokens can't be refreshed due to an error received from the Microsoft Account authorization server.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.OAuthDesktopMobileAuthCodeGrant
member.summary: Represents an OAuth authorization object implementing the authorization code grant flow for use in a desktop or mobile application.

remarks.para: You can use an instance of this class as the property of an object to authenticate with Bing Ads services. In this case the AuthenticationToken request header will be set to the corresponding value.

This class implements the authorization code grant flow for Managing User Authentication with OAuth documented at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=511609. This is a standard OAuth 2.0 flow and is defined in detail in the Authorization Code Grant section of the OAuth 2.0 spec at http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-15#section-4.1. For more information about registering a Bing Ads application, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=511607.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.PasswordAuthentication
member.summary: Represents a legacy Bing Ads authentication method using user name and password.

remarks.para: You can use an instance of this class as the Authentication property of a object to authenticate with Bing Ads services.

Existing users with legacy Bing Ads credentials may continue to specify the UserName and Password header elements. In future versions of the API, Bing Ads will transition exclusively to Microsoft Account authentication. New customers are required to sign up for Bing Ads with a Microsoft Account, and to manage those accounts you must use OAuth. For example instead of using this PasswordAuthentication class, you would authenticate with an instance of either , , or .

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.MatchType
member.summary: Defines the possible keyword match type values.
member.remarks:
See MatchType Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg712238(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by , , and data objects.
Used by GetEstimatedPositionByKeywords and GetHistoricalKeywordPerformance service operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.MatchType.Exact
member.summary: An exact match results when all of the words in the keyword exactly match the user's search query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.MatchType.Phrase
member.summary: A phrase match results when all of the words in the keyword are present in the user's search query and are in the same order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.MatchType.Broad
member.summary: A broad match results when words in the keyword are present in the user's search query; however, the word order can vary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.MatchType.Content
member.summary: A content match results when the keywords extracted from the content webpage match the keywords in the user's search query by using an exact match comparison. An exact match results when all of the words in the keyword exactly match the user's query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.MatchType.Aggregate
member.summary: Aggregates the data across all match types.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.Currency
member.summary:
Defines a selection of currency values.
The value set defines a broad selection of currency types; however, not all currencies are supported. For a list of supported currencies, see Currencies.
member.remarks:
See Currency Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg712234(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by , , and data objects.
Used by GetEstimatedBidByKeywords and GetEstimatedPositionByKeywords service operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordSearchCount
member.summary: Defines an object that contains the number of times the keyword was included in a search query on the specified device type. The count data is aggregated based on the aggregation level specified in the request.
member.remarks:
See KeywordSearchCount Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg712245(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by GetHistoricalSearchCount service operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordSearchCount.Keyword
member.summary: The keyword to which the search count data applies.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordSearchCount.Device
member.summary: The type of device on which users searched for the specified keyword.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordSearchCount.HistoricalSearchCounts
member.summary: An array of HistoricalSearchCountPeriodic objects that contain a count of the number of times that the keyword was used in a search query. The array contains an item for each month in the specified date range. The items are ordered by calendar month.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.HistoricalSearchCountPeriodic
member.summary: Defines an object that contains the number of times that the keyword was used in a search query during the specified time period.
member.remarks:
See HistoricalSearchCountPeriodic Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh921728(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.HistoricalSearchCountPeriodic.SearchCount
member.summary: The number of times that the keyword was used in a search query on the specified device type during the time period. The count aggregates data from all specified countries.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.HistoricalSearchCountPeriodic.DayMonthAndYear
member.summary: The time period in which the count was captured. The type of aggregation (daily, weekly, or monthly) that you specify in the request determines the length of the time period. For example, if you specified weekly aggregation, the time period is a week and the date is the Sunday of the week when the count was captured.

member.summary: The keyword to which the keyword performance data applies.

member.summary: The type of device on which the user entered their search query.

member.summary: An array of KeywordKPI objects that contains the performance data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordKPI
member.summary: Defines a key performance index object for a keyword. The object contains the historical performance statistics of the keyword for the specified match type and ad position.
member.remarks:
See KeywordKPI Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg986837(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordKPI.MatchType
member.summary: The match type that you specified in the request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordKPI.AdPosition
member.summary: The position in the search results in which the ad appeared.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordKPI.Clicks
member.summary: The number of clicks that the keyword and match type generated during the specified time interval.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordKPI.Impressions
member.summary: The number of impressions that the keyword and match type generated during the specified time interval.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordKPI.AverageCPC
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The average CPC is calculated by dividing the cost of all clicks by the number of clicks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordKPI.CTR
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) as a percentage. The CTR is calculated by dividing the number of clicks by the number of impressions and multiplying the result by 100.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordKPI.TotalCost
member.summary: The cost of using the specified keyword and match type during the specified time interval.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordKPI.AverageBid
member.summary: The average bid of the keyword.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordBidLandscape
member.summary:
Defines an object that contains a list of estimated clicks, cost, and impressions from 1 to 7 days for the keyword identifier given the suggested bid.
The estimates are not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks:
See KeywordBidLandscape Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631946(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.
Used by GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIds service operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordBidLandscape.KeywordId
member.summary: The keyword identifier.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordBidLandscape.StartDate
member.summary: The first date used to calculate the bid landscape. The start date is usually seven days prior to the end date.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordBidLandscape.EndDate
member.summary: The most recent date used to calculate the bid landscape. The end date should be approximately 2 days prior to today's date when the service is called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.KeywordBidLandscape.BidLandscapePoints
member.summary: The list of the total estimated clicks, cost, and impressions from StartDate to EndDate given the suggested bid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.BidLandscapePoint
member.summary:
Defines an object that contains estimates of clicks, cost, and impressions given the suggested bid.
The estimates are not a prediction or guarantee of future performance. Estimates are for search traffic only, and not based on performance for ads on the content network.
member.remarks:
See BidLandscapePoint Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631947(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by and data objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.BidLandscapePoint.Bid
member.summary: The suggested bid value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.BidLandscapePoint.Clicks
member.summary: The estimated number of clicks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.BidLandscapePoint.Impressions
member.summary: The estimated number of impressions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.BidLandscapePoint.TopImpressions
member.summary: The estimated number of impressions in the top or mainline ad results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.BidLandscapePoint.Currency
member.summary: The monetary unit of the suggested bid value and estimated performance statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.BidLandscapePoint.Cost
member.summary: The estimated cost.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.BidLandscapePoint.MarginalCPC
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.AdGroupBidLandscapeInput

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.AdGroupBidLandscape

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.AdGroupBidLandscape.EndDate

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.IAdIntelligenceService.GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIds(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Gets the estimated bid value of one or more keywords - specified by keyword identifier - that could have resulted in an ad appearing in the targeted position in the search results in the last 7 days. In addition, the operation provides estimates of clicks, average cost per click (CPC), and impressions that the keywords could have generated with the estimated bid.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks: See GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn336995(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of KeywordIdEstimatedBid objects. The array contains a corresponding item for each keyword specified in the request. If the keyword ID is not valid, the corresponding item in the array will be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.IAdIntelligenceService.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIds(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Given a list of existing keywords, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same keyword to help make decisions about how to adjust your keyword bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks: See GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631945(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of KeywordBidLandscape objects. The array contains a KeywordBidLandscape corresponding to each keyword specified in the request. Duplicate keyword identifiers are allowed in the same call and will return the same results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.IAdIntelligenceService.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIdsAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Given a list of existing keywords, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same keyword to help make decisions about how to adjust your keyword bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks: See GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631945(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of KeywordBidLandscape objects. The array contains a KeywordBidLandscape corresponding to each keyword specified in the request. Duplicate keyword identifiers are allowed in the same call and will return the same results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.IAdIntelligenceService.GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIds(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Given a list of existing ad groups, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same ad group to help make decisions about how to adjust your ad group level default bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
Currently bid landscape is only available in the United States. It is not recommended to use this service operation for accounts in other markets.
member.remarks: See GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743755(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of AdGroupBidLandscape objects. The array contains a AdGroupBidLandscape corresponding to each ad group and bid landscape type input specified in the request. Duplicate input are allowed in the same call and will return the same results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.IAdIntelligenceService.GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIdsAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Given a list of existing ad groups, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same ad group to help make decisions about how to adjust your ad group level default bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
Currently bid landscape is only available in the United States. It is not recommended to use this service operation for accounts in other markets.
member.remarks: See GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743755(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of AdGroupBidLandscape objects. The array contains a AdGroupBidLandscape corresponding to each ad group and bid landscape type input specified in the request. Duplicate input are allowed in the same call and will return the same results.

member.summary: The URL of the webpage to scan for possible keywords. The URL can contain a maximum of 2,000 characters.

member.summary: The language used by the website.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.SuggestKeywordsForUrlRequest.MaxKeywords
member.summary: A positive integer value that specifies the maximum number of keywords to return. The maximum value that you can specify is 200.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.SuggestKeywordsForUrlRequest.MinConfidenceScore
member.summary: A filter value that limits the keywords that the service returns to those that have a confidence score that is greater than or equal to the specified score. For example, you can specify that you want the operation to return only keywords that have a confidence score of at least 80 percent (0.8).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.SuggestKeywordsForUrlRequest.ExcludeBrand
member.summary: A value that determines whether the results exclude brand keywords. To exclude brand keywords in the result, set to true. The default is false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIdsResponse
member.summary:
Gets the estimated bid value of one or more keywords - specified by keyword identifier - that could have resulted in an ad appearing in the targeted position in the search results in the last 7 days. In addition, the operation provides estimates of clicks, average cost per click (CPC), and impressions that the keywords could have generated with the estimated bid.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks:
See GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIds Response Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn336995(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIds service operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIdsResponse.KeywordEstimatedBids
member.summary: An array of KeywordIdEstimatedBid objects. The array contains a corresponding item for each keyword specified in the request. If the keyword ID is not valid, the corresponding item in the array will be null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetEstimatedPositionByKeywordIdsRequest
member.summary:
Gets the estimated position in the search results if the specified bid value had been used for the keywords in the last 7 days. In addition, the operation provides estimates of clicks, average cost per click (CPC), and impressions that the keywords could have generated with the estimated bid.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.

member.summary: The maximum bid value to use to determine the estimated position in the search results.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIdsRequest
member.summary:
Given a list of existing keywords, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same keyword to help make decisions about how to adjust your keyword bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks:
See GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIds Request Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631945(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIds service operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIdsRequest.KeywordIds
member.summary: An array of identifiers of the keywords for which you want to get the list of suggested bid values with estimated performance statistics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIdsRequest.IncludeCurrentBid
member.summary: When set to false, the suggested bid values might not include the keyword's current bid. The default value is false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIdsRequest
member.summary:
Given a list of existing ad groups, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same ad group to help make decisions about how to adjust your ad group level default bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
Currently bid landscape is only available in the United States. It is not recommended to use this service operation for accounts in other markets.
member.remarks:
See GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIds Request Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743755(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.AdIntelligenceServiceClient.GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIds(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Gets the estimated bid value of one or more keywords - specified by keyword identifier - that could have resulted in an ad appearing in the targeted position in the search results in the last 7 days. In addition, the operation provides estimates of clicks, average cost per click (CPC), and impressions that the keywords could have generated with the estimated bid.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks: See GetEstimatedBidByKeywordIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn336995(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of KeywordIdEstimatedBid objects. The array contains a corresponding item for each keyword specified in the request. If the keyword ID is not valid, the corresponding item in the array will be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.AdIntelligenceServiceClient.GetEstimatedPositionByKeywordIds(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetEstimatedPositionByKeywordIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Gets the estimated position in the search results if the specified bid value had been used for the keywords in the last 7 days. In addition, the operation provides estimates of clicks, average cost per click (CPC), and impressions that the keywords could have generated with the estimated bid.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks: See GetEstimatedPositionByKeywordIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn336989(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: A list of KeywordIdEstimatedPosition objects. The array contains an item for each keyword specified in the request. If the keyword ID is not valid, the corresponding item in the array will be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.AdIntelligenceServiceClient.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIds(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Given a list of existing keywords, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same keyword to help make decisions about how to adjust your keyword bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks: See GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631945(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of KeywordBidLandscape objects. The array contains a KeywordBidLandscape corresponding to each keyword specified in the request. Duplicate keyword identifiers are allowed in the same call and will return the same results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.AdIntelligenceServiceClient.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIdsAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Given a list of existing keywords, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same keyword to help make decisions about how to adjust your keyword bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks: See GetBidLandscapeByKeywordIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631945(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of KeywordBidLandscape objects. The array contains a KeywordBidLandscape corresponding to each keyword specified in the request. Duplicate keyword identifiers are allowed in the same call and will return the same results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.AdIntelligenceServiceClient.GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIds(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Given a list of existing ad groups, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same ad group to help make decisions about how to adjust your ad group level default bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
Currently bid landscape is only available in the United States. It is not recommended to use this service operation for accounts in other markets.
member.remarks: See GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743755(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of AdGroupBidLandscape objects. The array contains a AdGroupBidLandscape corresponding to each ad group and bid landscape type input specified in the request. Duplicate input are allowed in the same call and will return the same results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.AdIntelligenceServiceClient.GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIdsAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.AdIntelligence.GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIdsRequest)
member.summary:
Given a list of existing ad groups, this operation returns for each a list of suggested bids and estimated performance statistics. You can use the landscape view of multiple bid points with estimated traffic for the same ad group to help make decisions about how to adjust your ad group level default bid to optimize for clicks, impressions, and cost. For example you might use the resulting data to visualize a clicks to cost curve or a bid to impressions curve.
The estimates are based on the last 7 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
Currently bid landscape is only available in the United States. It is not recommended to use this service operation for accounts in other markets.
member.remarks: See GetBidLandscapeByAdGroupIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743755(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of AdGroupBidLandscape objects. The array contains a AdGroupBidLandscape corresponding to each ad group and bid landscape type input specified in the request. Duplicate input are allowed in the same call and will return the same results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.IBulkService.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIds(Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest)
member.summary: Downloads an account's campaign data. You can request all campaign data or only the data that has changed since the last time you downloaded the account.
member.remarks: See DownloadCampaignsByAccountIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj885755(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The identifier of the download request. You use the identifier to call the GetDetailedBulkDownloadStatus operation to check the status of the download. The identifier is valid for a maximum of two days. If you have not successfully downloaded the file within this period, it is removed from the download site and you will need to get a new download request identifier.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest
member.summary: Downloads an account's campaign data. You can request all campaign data or only the data that has changed since the last time you downloaded the account.
member.remarks:
See DownloadCampaignsByAccountIds Request Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj885755(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by DownloadCampaignsByAccountIds service operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest.AccountIds
member.summary: The identifier of the account that contains the campaign data to download. The maximum number of accounts that you can specify is one.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest.DataScope
member.summary: You may include performance data such as spend, in addition to entity data such as campaign settings. The default is EntityData which will exclude performance data from the download.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest.DownloadFileType
member.summary: The file type of the download file. For possible values, see DownloadFileType. The default is CSV.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest.Entities
member.summary: The entities to include in the download. For a list of entities that you can download, see the BulkDownloadEntity value set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest.FormatVersion
member.summary: The format for records of the download file. Possible values are 3.0, 2.0 and 1.0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest.LastSyncTimeInUTC
member.summary: The last time that you requested a download. The date and time is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest.LocationTargetVersion
member.summary: The version of the location codes to return if the target contains location targets. You should set this element if you set AdditionalEntities to CampaignTargets or AdGroupTargets.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest.PerformanceStatsDateRange
member.summary: Defines the start and end date when downloading performance data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.BulkServiceClient.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIds(Microsoft.BingAds.Bulk.DownloadCampaignsByAccountIdsRequest)
member.summary: Downloads an account's campaign data. You can request all campaign data or only the data that has changed since the last time you downloaded the account.
member.remarks: See DownloadCampaignsByAccountIds Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj885755(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The identifier of the download request. You use the identifier to call the GetDetailedBulkDownloadStatus operation to check the status of the download. The identifier is valid for a maximum of two days. If you have not successfully downloaded the file within this period, it is removed from the download site and you will need to get a new download request identifier.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign
member.summary: Defines a campaign.
member.remarks:
See Campaign Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672054(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by AddCampaigns, GetCampaignsByAccountId, GetCampaignsByIds and UpdateCampaigns service operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.BudgetType
member.summary: The budget type determines whether the campaign uses a daily budget or a monthly budget, and how the budget is spent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.ConversionTrackingEnabled
member.summary: Conversion tracking is no longer supported at the campaign level. If you set this element, the value is ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.DailyBudget
member.summary: The amount to spend daily on the campaign. You must set the daily budget amount if BudgetType is set to DailyBudgetAccelerated or DailyBudgetStandard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.DaylightSaving
member.summary: Determines whether daylight-saving time is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.Description
member.summary: The description of the campaign. The description can contain a maximum of 1,000 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.ForwardCompatibilityMap
member.summary: The following list of key and value strings are available for forward compatibility.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.Id
member.summary: The system-generated identifier of the campaign.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.MonthlyBudget
member.summary: The monthly budget of the campaign. You must specify a monthly budget only if BudgetType is set to MonthlyBudgetSpendUntilDepleted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.Name
member.summary: The name of the campaign. The name must be unique among all active or paused campaigns within the account. The name can contain a maximum of 128 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.Status
member.summary: The status of the campaign.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.TimeZone
member.summary: The time zone where the campaign operates. For possible values, see Time Zones.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Campaign.CampaignType
member.summary: The campaign type determines whether the campaign is a Bing Shopping campaign or a Search & Content campaign.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BudgetLimitType
member.summary: Defines the possible budget types that you can specify for a campaign.
member.remarks:
See BudgetLimitType Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672035(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BudgetLimitType.MonthlyBudgetSpendUntilDepleted
member.summary: A monthly budget that is spent until it is depleted. Depending on the activity, the complete budget could be spent in a couple of days, weeks, or not at all.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BudgetLimitType.DailyBudgetAccelerated
member.summary: A daily budget that is spent until it is depleted. Depending on the activity, the complete budget could be spent within a couple of minutes, hours, or not at all.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BudgetLimitType.DailyBudgetStandard
member.summary: A daily budget that is spread throughout the day.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CampaignStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible status values of a campaign.
member.remarks:
See CampaignStatus Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672025(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CampaignStatus.Active
member.summary: The campaign is active, which indicates that the campaign's ads can be served.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CampaignStatus.Paused
member.summary: The campaign is paused, which indicates that the campaign's ads will not serve.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CampaignStatus.BudgetPaused
member.summary: The campaign is paused, which indicates that the campaign's ads will not serve. The service sets this status when the budget is depleted. The service will set the status back to Active when the budget is restored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CampaignStatus.BudgetAndManualPaused
member.summary: The campaign is paused, which indicates that the campaign's ads will not serve. This status results when a user sets the campaign status to paused after the service pauses the campaign because the budget is depleted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CampaignStatus.Deleted
member.summary: The campaign is deleted. This status is for internal use only. Because all Get operations do not return deleted objects, you will not see an object with this status.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CampaignStatus.Suspended
member.summary: Your campaign has been suspended and no ads are eligible for delivery because of potentially fraudulent activity. Please contact Bing Ads Support.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CampaignType
member.summary: Defines the possible campaign types.
member.remarks:

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdGroup.BroadMatchBid
member.summary: The bid to use when the user's query and the ad group's keywords match by using a broad match comparison. A broad match results when words in the keyword are present in the user's query; however, the order of the words can vary.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdGroup.ContentMatchBid
member.summary: The bid to use when the keywords that the service extracts from the content page and the ad group's keywords match by using an exact match comparison. An exact match results when all of the words in the keyword exactly match the user's query.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdGroup.EndDate
member.summary: The date that the ads in the ad group will expire. If you do not specify an end date, the ads will not expire.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdGroup.ExactMatchBid
member.summary: The bid to use when the user's query and the ad group's keywords match by using an exact match comparison. An exact match results when all of the words in the keyword exactly match the user's query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdDistribution.Content
member.summary: The ads are displayed on Microsoft-owned websites, as well as on participating partner websites. Ads are not triggered by a search query, and rather, they appear on pages that are relevant to the keywords you have bid on. The content distribution network includes Bing owned-and-operated sites, Yahoo owned-and-operated sites, and syndicated partner sites that are typically focused on specific interests, such as cars (MSN Autos), finance (MSN Money), or computers (PC World).

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Target
member.summary:
Defines the types of targeting that you can use to target your ads to users. For example, you can target your ads based on the geographic location of the user, the day of the week, or the time of the day.
When adding or updating a target, at least one target type must be specified. When attempting to retrieve targets for a campaign or ad group, the Target element could be nil. For more information, see Default Target Settings.
member.remarks:
See Target Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671789(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by AddTargetsToLibrary, GetTargetsByAdGroupIds, GetTargetsByCampaignIds, GetTargetsByIds and UpdateTargetsInLibrary service operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.HourTarget
member.summary:
Defines a list of hour target ranges with bid adjustments.
The service applies the time ranges based on the local time where the user made the search query. For example if you target SevenAMToElevenAM , a user on the east coast may see the ad between 7:00 AM and 11:00 AM Eastern Time, while someone on the west coast may see it between 7:00 AM and 11:00 AM Pacific Time.
member.remarks:
See HourTarget Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671826(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Target2
member.summary:
Defines the types of targeting that you can use to target your ads to users. For example, you can target your ads based on the geographic location of the user, the day of the week, or the time of the day.
This object includes the DayTimeTarget and LocationTarget2 objects, which are not included in the legacy Target object.
The following service operations are reserved for working with Target2 objects.
The following service operations may be used with either Target or Target2 objects.
The following service operations are reserved for working with the legacy Target objects.
When adding or updating a target, at least one target type must be specified. When attempting to retrieve targets for a campaign or ad group, the Target2 element could be nil. For more information, see Default Target Settings.
member.remarks:
See Target2 Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743781(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by AddTargetsToLibrary2, GetTargetsByAdGroupIds2, GetTargetsByCampaignIds2, GetTargetsByIds2 and UpdateTargetsInLibrary2 service operations.

member.summary: Targets ads to run on specific days and hours of the week.

member.summary: Targets ads to serve on specific devices.

member.summary: Targets ads to men only or women only.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AppAdExtension
member.summary:
Currently this feature is only available for pilot participants. For more information, see GetCustomerPilotFeatures Service Operation.
Defines an app ad extension that can be included in a text ad.
You can associate an app ad extension with one or more campaigns, and a campaign can be associated with multiple app ad extensions.
The AppAdExtension object derives from the AdExtension object. For a list of inherited elements, see the AdExtension object.
member.remarks: See AppAdExtension Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn817898(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AppAdExtension.AppPlatform
member.summary: The application platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AppAdExtension.AppStoreId
member.summary: The application identifier provided by the app store.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AppAdExtension.DestinationUrl
member.summary: The URL of the app store download webpage that users are taken to when they click the app extension link. The URL can contain a maximum of 1,024 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AppAdExtension.DevicePreference
member.summary: This element determines whether the preference is for the app extension to be displayed on mobile devices or all devices.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AppAdExtension.DisplayText
member.summary: The text displayed in the app ad extension. The text can contain a maximum of 35 characters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.SiteLinksAdExtension
member.summary:
Defines an ad extension that specifies one or more site links to add to a text ad.
The SiteLinksAdExtension object derives from the AdExtension object. For a list of inherited elements, see the AdExtension object.
member.remarks: See SiteLinksAdExtension Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj134387(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.SiteLinksAdExtension.SiteLinks
member.summary: A list of site links. Each object contains a link to a webpage on your website. You can specify a maximum of 10 site links, and the search engine determines a subset of links to include in the ad. If you specify the Description1 and Description2 elements of each site link, then up to four site links will be displayed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductAdExtension
member.summary:
Defines a product ad extension. The extension identifies a Bing Merchant Center store that contains the products that you want to advertise.
Product ads are only available in the United States.
The ProductAdExtension object derives from the AdExtension object. For a list of inherited elements, see the AdExtension object.
member.remarks: See ProductAdExtension Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj721706(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductAdExtension.Name
member.summary: The display name of the extension. The name can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductAdExtension.ProductSelection
member.summary: The list of products from the Bing Merchant Center store to advertise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductAdExtension.StoreId
member.summary: The identifier of the Bing Merchant Center store contains the products to advertise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductAdExtension.StoreName
member.summary: The name of the store that StoreId identifies.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ImageAdExtension
member.summary:
Currently this feature is only available for pilot participants.
Defines an ad extension that specifies an image with alternative text to include in a text ad.
The ImageAdExtension object derives from the AdExtension object. For a list of inherited elements, see the AdExtension object.
member.remarks: See ImageAdExtension Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn766199(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ImageAdExtension.AlternativeText
member.summary: Alternative description of the image media for usability. If the image could not be displayed, the alternative text is used instead.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ImageAdExtension.Description
member.summary: Description that can be used by the advertiser, agency, or account manager to track, label, or manage image media. This description is not displayed with the ad or image.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ImageAdExtension.DestinationUrl
member.summary: The URL of the webpage to take the user to when they click the image.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ImageAdExtension.ImageMediaId
member.summary: The identifier of the image to include in the ad. You must specify the identifier of the image that you added to the image library by calling the AddMedia operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CallAdExtension
member.summary:
Defines an object that specifies a click-to-call phone number to include in a text ad.
You can associate a call ad extension with one or more campaigns; however, a campaign can be associated with only one call ad extension.
The CallAdExtension object derives from the AdExtension object. For a list of inherited elements, see the AdExtension object.
member.remarks: See CallAdExtension Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj721598(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CallAdExtension.CountryCode
member.summary: The country code where the phone number is registered. The country code must contain a 2 character country code. For a list of country code values, see Geographical Location Codes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CallAdExtension.DevicePreference
member.summary: This element determines whether the preference is for the click to call phone number to be displayed on mobile devices or all devices.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CallAdExtension.IsCallOnly
member.summary: A Boolean value that determines whether the phone number is the only clickable item in the ad. If true and the ad is displayed on a hi-fi mobile device, all otherwise clickable items such as addresses, the display URL, and site links will be disabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CallAdExtension.IsCallTrackingEnabled
member.summary: A Boolean value that determines whether call tracking is enabled for the call ad extension.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CallAdExtension.PhoneNumber
member.summary: The phone number to include in the ad. The phone number is clickable on hi-fi mobile devices.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.CallAdExtension.RequireTollFreeTrackingNumber
member.summary: A Boolean value that determines whether a toll-free tracking number should be created for call tracking. This element can only be set if IsCallTrackingEnabled is also true.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.LocationAdExtension
member.summary:
Defines an ad extension that specifies a business' address and phone number to include in a text ad.
The LocationAdExtension object derives from the AdExtension object. For a list of inherited elements, see the AdExtension object.
member.remarks: See LocationAdExtension Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj721600(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.LocationAdExtension.Address
member.summary: The business' address.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.LocationAdExtension.CompanyName
member.summary: The name of the business. The name can contain a maximum of 80 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.LocationAdExtension.GeoCodeStatus
member.summary: A status value that indicates whether the business' latitude and longitude coordinates have been determined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.LocationAdExtension.GeoPoint
member.summary: The latitude and longitude coordinates of the specified Address element. The coordinates are used to mark the business' location on Bing Maps when the user clicks the address on the ad. If the specified coordinates are not within the range of valid values, the service determines the coordinates based on the address.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.LocationAdExtension.IconMediaId
member.summary: The identifier of an icon used to mark the business' location on Bing Maps. You can specify the identifier of a predefined icon or a custom icon that you added by calling the AddMedia operation. The size of a custom icon can be up to 26x26.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.LocationAdExtension.ImageMediaId
member.summary: The identifier of the image to include in the ad. You must specify the identifier of the image that you added to the image library by calling the AddMedia operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.LocationAdExtension.PhoneNumber
member.summary: The business' phone number to include in the ad. The phone number is clickable on hi-fi mobile devices.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdExtensionStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible status values of an ad extension.

See AdExtensionStatus Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj134386(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdExtensionStatus.Active
member.summary: The ad extension is active. You can associate an active ad extension with a campaign or ad group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdExtensionStatus.Deleted
member.summary: The ad extension is deleted. This status is for internal use only. The Get operations will not include deleted extensions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.SiteLink

See SiteLink Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj134381(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The site link description line 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.SiteLink.Description2
member.summary: The site link description line 2.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.SiteLink.DestinationUrl

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.SiteLink.DevicePreference
member.summary: This element determines whether the preference is for site links to be displayed on mobile devices or all devices.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.SiteLink.DisplayText
member.summary: The site-link text displayed in the ad.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductConditionCollection.Conditions
member.summary: A list of conditions that determine whether a product from the Bing Merchant Center store gets served as a product ad. You can specify a maximum of 8 conditions. For a product to be served, it must meet all conditions.

member.summary: The condition's attribute value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductCondition.Operand
member.summary: The condition's operand. The operands implicitly include the equal operator. For example, read Brand as Brand=.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Address

See Address Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj721596(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Address.CityName
member.summary: The name of the city where the street address is located. The name can contain a maximum of 80 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Address.CountryCode
member.summary: The country where the street address is located. The country code must contain a 2 character country code. For a list of possible country codes that you can specify, see Publisher Country.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Address.PostalCode
member.summary: The postal or zip code. The postal code can contain a maximum of 80 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Address.ProvinceCode
member.summary: A code that identifies the state or province where the street address is located. For example, WA. The code can contain a maximum of 50 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Address.ProvinceName
member.summary: The name of the state or province where the street address is located. For example, Washington. The name can contain a maximum of 50 characters.

member.summary: The first line of the address. The first line can contain a maximum of 80 characters

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Address.StreetAddress2

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.GeoPoint

member.remarks:
See GeoPoint Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj721599(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.GeoPoint.LatitudeInMicroDegrees
member.summary: The latitude specified in micro degrees. The latitude must be greater than or equal to -85000000 and less than or equal to +85000000.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.GeoPoint.LongitudeInMicroDegrees
member.summary: The longitude specified in micro degrees. The longitude must be greater than or equal to -180000000 and less than or equal to +180000000.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BusinessGeoCodeStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible status values that indicate the progress of determining the latitude and longitude values of a business.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BusinessGeoCodeStatus.Pending
member.summary: In the process of determining the latitude and longitude of the business.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BusinessGeoCodeStatus.Complete
member.summary: Successfully determined the latitude and longitude of the business.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BusinessGeoCodeStatus.Invalid
member.summary: Unable to determine the latitude and longitude of the business, possibly because the address did not resolve.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BusinessGeoCodeStatus.Failed
member.summary: Unable to determine the latitude and longitude of the business.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.NegativeAdGroupCriterion
member.summary:
This feature is currently in pilot and will be generally available soon.
Defines a negative ad group criterion that can be used to abstain from bidding on the Bing Shopping products in this ad group. You can still bid on these products in any other ad group in the same campaign, and within ad groups of lower priority campaigns.
member.remarks: See NegativeAdGroupCriterion Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn913133(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdGroupCriterionStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible status values that determine whether to apply the criterion to the ad group.

Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdGroupCriterionStatus.Active
member.summary: Apply the criterion to the ad group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdGroupCriterionStatus.Paused
member.summary: Do not apply the criterion to the ad group.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.AdGroupCriterionStatus.Deleted
member.summary: The criterion was deleted. Note that the Get operations will not return deleted objects.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductScope
member.summary:
This feature is currently in pilot and will be generally available soon.
Defines a campaign level product scope with list of conditions that help determine whether a product from the Bing Merchant Center store gets served as a product ad.
ProductScope can only be specified for a campaign criterion, and may not be specified as an ad group criterion.
member.remarks: See ProductScope Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn913124(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductScope.Conditions
member.summary: A list of up to 7 product conditions that helps determine whether a product from the Bing Merchant Center store gets served as an ad.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Product
member.summary:
Defines a campaign level product criterion, which includes a list of conditions that determine whether a product from the Bing Merchant Center store gets served as a product ad.
Product can only be specified for a campaign criterion, and may not be specified as an ad group criterion.
member.remarks: See Product Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj689539(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.Product.Conditions
member.summary: A list of conditions that determine whether a product from the Bing Merchant Center store gets served as a product ad. You can specify a maximum of 3 conditions. For a product to be served, it must meet all conditions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductPartition
member.summary:
This feature is currently in pilot and will be generally available soon.
Defines an ad group level product partition with one condition that helps determine whether a product from the Bing Merchant Center store gets served as a product ad.
ProductPartition can only be specified for an ad group criterion, and may not be specified as a campaign criterion.
member.remarks: See ProductPartition Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn913123(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.ProductPartition.Condition

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BMCStore
member.summary:
Defines a Bing Merchant Center store.
Elements of this object are defined in the Bing Merchant Center store, and read-only in Bing Ads. Values of elements do not restrict Bing Ads features. For example, a product ad extension may be added whether the IsActive element is set to true or false.
member.remarks:
See BMCStore Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn411606(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by GetBMCStoresByCustomerId service operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.NegativeKeyword
member.summary:
Defines a negative keyword with match type. A negative keyword can be added and deleted, but cannot be updated.
You may choose to associate an exclusive set of negative keywords to an individual campaign or ad group. An exclusive set of negative keywords cannot be shared with other campaigns or ad groups. Negative keywords can also be added and deleted from a shared negative keyword list. The negative keyword list can be shared or associated with multiple campaigns.
The same negative keyword and match type can be added to all campaigns, ad groups, and negative keyword lists if you choose. Each instance must be added and associated individually and would be assigned a unique negative keyword identifier.
For more information about managing negative keywords and negative keyword lists, please see the technical guide about Negative Keywords.
member.remarks:
See NegativeKeyword Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743739(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BatchErrorCollection
member.summary:
Currently this feature is only available in production for pilot participants, and will be generally available for all advertisers in Q3 2014. This feature is already available in sandbox for all advertisers.
Defines an error object that contains batch error details for the top level list index and a list of batch errors corresponding to the nested list index. For example in the NestedPartialErrors response element for AddNegativeKeywordsToEntities, the top level list index corresponds to the campaign or ad group index identifier. The nested list of batch errors would include any errors specific to the negative keywords that you attempted to add to the campaign or ad group.
member.remarks:
See BatchErrorCollection Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743731(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by AddNegativeKeywordsToEntities and DeleteNegativeKeywordsFromEntities service operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BatchErrorCollection.BatchErrors
member.summary: A list of batch errors corresponding to the nested list index.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BatchErrorCollection.Code
member.summary: A numeric error code that identifies the error for the top level list index.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BatchErrorCollection.Details
member.summary: A message that provides additional details about the batch error for the top level list index. This string can be empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BatchErrorCollection.ErrorCode
member.summary: A symbolic string constant that identifies the error for the top level list index.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BatchErrorCollection.Index
member.summary: The zero-based top level list index in the request message that failed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CampaignManagement.BatchErrorCollection.Message
member.summary: A message that describes the error for the top level list index.

member.summary:
Gets the media meta data of the specified entity type from an account's media library.
