member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.BillingDocument.Data
member.summary: The billing document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.BillingDocument.Id
member.summary: The identifier of the billing document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.BillingDocument.Type
member.summary: The format of the billing document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder
member.summary:
Defines an insertion order.
An account can have multiple active insertion orders, and only one insertion order is spending at a time. The spending insertion order is the one with the earliest end date.
Only the Status element of an insertion order may be updated, for example to approve, decline, or cancel an insertion order.
member.remarks:
See InsertionOrder Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff728378(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by AddInsertionOrder, GetInsertionOrdersByAccount, SearchInsertionOrders and UpdateInsertionOrder service operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.AccountId
member.summary: The identifier of the account to which the insertion order applies.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.BalanceAmount
member.summary: The running balance of the insertion order. The running balance value is initially the same as the spending limit, and then decreases each time an ad in the account is served.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.BookingCountryCode
member.summary: A code that identifies the country/region in which the account operates. For a list of country code values, see Geographical Location Codes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.Comment
member.summary: A description of the insertion order. The description is limited to 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.EndDate
member.summary: The date that the insertion order expires. The end date must be later than the start date.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.InsertionOrderId
member.summary: A system generated identifier that identifies the insertion order.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.LastModifiedByUserId
member.summary: An identifier of the last user to update the insertion order.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.LastModifiedTime
member.summary: The date and time that the insertion order was last updated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.NotificationThreshold
member.summary: A percentage of the budget that has been spent. Specify the percentage as a value from 0 to 100. Notification is sent when the threshold is reached. For example, if you set the threshold to 70, the Billing service sends notification when you have spent 70 percent of the budget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.ReferenceId
member.summary: Internal use only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.SpendCapAmount
member.summary: The budget for this insertion order. The budget is a hard limit. When the account reaches this limit and there is not another insertion order available, the account's lifecycle status value is set to Pause.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.StartDate
member.summary: The date that the insertion order can begin accruing charges. The start date must be later than the current date.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.Name
member.summary: The friendly name that can be used to reference this insertion order.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.Status
member.summary: The status of the insertion order.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrder.PurchaseOrder
member.summary: A purchase order value that can be used to reference this insertion order in monthly invoices. This value will be printed as the purchase order in the monthly invoices.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrderStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible status values of an InsertionOrder.
member.remarks:
See InsertionOrderStatus Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743761(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrderStatus.PendingSystemReview
member.summary: A super admin of the bill-to customer added the insertion order, and the insertion order is pending account manager approval.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrderStatus.PendingUserReview
member.summary: An account manager added the insertion order, and the insertion order is pending approval from the super admin of the bill-to customer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrderStatus.Active
member.summary: The insertion order is active, which means that the account and its campaigns will begin showing ads once the start date is reached. Even if the spending limit has been reached and the balance is depleted, the insertion order status can be active.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrderStatus.Declined
member.summary: Either the super admin of the bill-to customer or the account manager declined the insertion order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrderStatus.Expired
member.summary: The end date or spend limit of the insertion order is reached, which means that the insertion order is expired or inactive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerBilling.InsertionOrderStatus.Canceled
member.summary: Either the super admin of the bill-to customer or the account manager canceled the insertion order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountLifeCycleStatus.Draft
member.summary: The account is in a draft state. When you add an account, the system sets the status to Draft. After the system validates the payment instrument, the status changes to Active. You cannot add another account while the customer has an account in the Draft state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountLifeCycleStatus.Active
member.summary: The account is active, which means that the account and its campaigns can be managed and its ads served.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountLifeCycleStatus.Inactive
member.summary: The account is inactive, which means that the system deleted the account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountLifeCycleStatus.Pause
member.summary: For internal use only. You may update the account and its campaigns while the account is in the paused state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountLifeCycleStatus.Pending
member.summary: For internal use only. You may update the account and its campaigns while the account is in the pending state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountLifeCycleStatus.Suspended
member.summary: Your account has been suspended and no ads are eligible for delivery because of potentially fraudulent activity. Please contact Bing Ads Support.

member.summary: The type of the account. For example, whether the account is an advertiser account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.BillToCustomerId
member.summary: The identifier of the customer that is billed for the charges that the account generates. This is either the reseller that manages this account on behalf of the owner or the identifier of the customer that owns the account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.CountryCode
member.summary: The code that identifies the country/region in which the account operates. The service uses the country/region information for billing purposes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.CurrencyType
member.summary: The type of currency that is used to settle the account. The service uses the currency information for billing purposes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.AccountFinancialStatus
member.summary: The financial status of the account. For example, the status can indicate whether the account is in good standing or is past due.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.Id
member.summary: The system generated identifier of the account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.Language

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.ForwardCompatibilityMap
member.summary: The following list of key and value strings are available for forward compatibility.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.LastModifiedByUserId
member.summary: The identifier of the last user to update the account's information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.LastModifiedTime
member.summary: The date and time that the account was last updated. The value is in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.Name
member.summary: The name of the account. The name can contain a maximum of 100 characters and must be unique within the customer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.Number
member.summary: The system generated account number that is used to identify the account in the Bing Ads web application. The account number has the form xxxxxxxx, where xxxxxxxx is a series of any eight alphanumeric characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.PaymentMethodType

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Account.PrimaryUserId

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CurrencyType
member.summary:
Defines a selection of currency values.
The value set defines a broad selection of currency types; however, not all currencies are supported. For a list of supported currencies, see Currencies.
member.remarks:
See CurrencyType Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671938(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible financial status values of an account.
member.remarks:
See AccountFinancialStatus Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff728399(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.Proposed
member.summary: For an advertiser account, this status indicates that the customer can add campaigns to the account; however, the service will not deliver the account's ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.PendingCreditCheck
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.ClearFinancialStatus
member.summary: The account is in good standing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.SoldToOnly
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.CreditWarning
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.Hold
member.summary: For an advertiser account, this status indicates that the account is past due. The service will not deliver the account's ads until the account is settled. For a credit card account, this status indicates that the card has been declined three times.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.WriteOff
member.summary: The account is past due; however, collection is no longer being pursued. When this status is set, the Status element of Account data object will be set to Inactive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.TaxOnHold
member.summary: For a publisher account, this status indicates that the publisher has yet to provide a valid tax instrument. The service continues to deliver the account's ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.UserHold
member.summary: For a publisher account, this status indicates that the payout to the publisher was placed on hold by publisher. The service continues to deliver the account's ads.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.LanguageType
member.summary:
Defines a selection of language values.
The value set defines a broad selection of languages; however, not all languages are supported. For a list of supported languages, see Ad Languages.
member.remarks:
See LanguageType Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672074(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by and data objects.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType
member.summary:
The value set defines a broad selection of languages; however, not all languages are supported. For a list of supported languages, see Ad Languages.
Defines the possible payment methods of an account.
member.remarks:
See PaymentMethodType Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee704164(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.CreditCard
member.summary: The payments are made with a credit card.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.Invoice
member.summary: An invoice is sent to the customer requesting payment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.Check
member.summary: The payments are made with a check. Not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.ElectronicFundsTransfer
member.summary: The payments are made with an electronic funds transfer. Not supported.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.TimeZoneType
member.summary:
Defines the possible time zones for the customer management service.
The value set defines the full set of time zones. For more information, see Time Zones.
member.remarks:
See TimeZoneType Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn451293(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer
member.summary: Defines a customer.
member.remarks:
See Customer Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671875(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by GetAccessibleCustomer, GetCustomer, SearchCustomers, SignupCustomer and UpdateCustomer service operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.CustomerAddress
member.summary: The customer's business address.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.CustomerFinancialStatus
member.summary: The financial status of the customer. For example, the status indicates whether the customer is in good standing or one or more of the accounts are past due.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.Id
member.summary: The system generated customer identifier.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.Industry
member.summary: The primary business segment of the customer (for example, automotive, food, or entertainment).

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.LastModifiedByUserId
member.summary: The identifier of the last user to update the customer's information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.LastModifiedTime
member.summary: The date and time that the customer information was last updated. The value is in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.MarketCountry
member.summary: The primary country where the customer operates. For possible values, see Geographical Location Codes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.ForwardCompatibilityMap
member.summary: The list of key and value strings for forward compatibility. This element can be used to avoid otherwise breaking changes when new elements are added in future releases.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.MarketLanguage
member.summary: The primary language that the customer uses.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.Name
member.summary: The name of the customer. The name can contain a maximum of 90 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.ServiceLevel
member.summary: For internal use only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.CustomerLifeCycleStatus
member.summary: The status of the customer. When you create the customer, the status is set to Active. You cannot change the status.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.TimeStamp
member.summary: A time-stamp value that the system uses internally to reconcile updates when you call the UpdateCustomer or DeleteCustomer operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Customer.Number
member.summary: A system-generated customer number that is used in the Bing Ads web application. The customer number is of the form, C nnnnnnn, where nnnnnnn is a series of digits.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Address

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Address.Line2
member.summary: The second line of the address, which can contain a maximum of 35 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Address.Line3
member.summary: The third line of the address, which can contain a maximum of 35 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Address.Line4
member.summary: The fourth line of the address, which can contain a maximum of 35 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Address.PostalCode
member.summary: The Postal or ZIP Code, which can contain a maximum of 10 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.Address.StateOrProvince
member.summary: The state or province. This element is required for countries that define sub geographies, but should be set to null for countries that do not define sub geographies, such as Singapore.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerFinancialStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible financial status values of a customer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerFinancialStatus.ProposalsOnly
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerFinancialStatus.PendingCreditCheck
member.summary: The customer is undergoing a credit check as part of the customer sign-up process. The service will not deliver the customer's ads until the credit check is complete. This status applies only to premium customers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerFinancialStatus.ClearFinancialStatus
member.summary: The customer is in good standing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerFinancialStatus.SoldToOnly
member.summary: The customer is considered to be a credit risk. You cannot set the BillToCustomerId element of the Account data object to a customer that has this status. This status applies only to premium customers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerFinancialStatus.CreditHold
member.summary: One of the customer's accounts is past due.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerFinancialStatus.CreditWarning
member.summary: Not used.

member.summary: The name of the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.User.SecretAnswer
member.summary: The answer to the secret question that is specified in the SecretQuestion element. The answer must contain a minimum of five characters and a maximum of 64 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.User.SecretQuestion
member.summary: A question from a list of predefined questions that the user selects to use as his or her secret question. The SecretAnswer element contains the user's answer to the question. The secret question and answer are used to validate the user in case the user forgets his or her password, and requests it.

member.summary: The status of the user.

member.summary: A time-stamp value that the system uses internally to reconcile updates when you call the UpdateUser or DeleteUser operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.User.UserName
member.summary: If the value of IsMigratedToMicrosoftAccount is false, this element contains the user's Bing Ads managed sign-in user name. The name is case-insensitive.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.User.IsMigratedToMicrosoftAccount
member.summary: If true, the user can be authenticated using a Microsoft Account. For more information, see Managing User Authentication with OAuth.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo
member.summary: Defines the contact information for a user.

Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.Address
member.summary: The address of the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.ContactByPhone
member.summary: A value that determines whether the user should be contacted by telephone. If true, the telephone number specified in the Phone1 element is used to contact the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.ContactByPostalMail
member.summary: A value that determines whether the user should be contacted by postal mail. If true, correspondence is sent to the address specified in the Address element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.Email
member.summary: The email address is used to send the account activation notification to the user, and can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.EmailFormat
member.summary: The format of the body of an email message to use when correspondence is sent to the user (this does not apply to the activation notification email message).

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.Fax
member.summary: The fax telephone number of the user. The telephone number can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.HomePhone
member.summary: The home telephone number of the user. The telephone number can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.Id
member.summary: The system generated identifier of the object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.Mobile
member.summary: The mobile telephone number of the user. The telephone number can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.Phone1
member.summary: The primary telephone number of the user. The telephone number can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ContactInfo.Phone2
member.summary: An alternate telephone number for the user. The telephone number can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Defines a client link object. Acceptance of a client link invitation enables an agency to manage the corresponding client accounts. To send an invitation to manage a client account, call the AddClientLinks operation and specify one client link per account to manage. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
This object does not have a system defined identifier. To uniquely identify a client link, use either the ClientAccountId or ClientAccountNumber paired with either the ManagingCustomerId or ManagingCustomerNumber.
member.remarks:
See ClientLink Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632189(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by AddClientLinks, SearchClientLinks and UpdateClientLinks service operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.ClientAccountId
member.summary: The identifier of the client account to manage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.ClientAccountNumber
member.summary: The number of the client account to manage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.ManagingCustomerId
member.summary: The identifier of the customer who manages or is requesting to manage the client account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.ManagingCustomerNumber
member.summary: The number of the customer who manages or is requesting to manage the client account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.Note
member.summary: Optional message from the requestor providing context and details about the client link invitation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.Name
member.summary: The friendly name that can be used to reference this client link.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.InviterEmail
member.summary: The email of the user who created the client link request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.InviterName
member.summary: The name of the parent customer of the user who created the client link request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.InviterPhone
member.summary: The phone number of the user who created the client link request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.IsBillToClient
member.summary: Determines whether the owner of the client account or the managing customer is responsible for billing payments.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.StartDate
member.summary: The date when the status would update. For an accepted link request the status would transition towards Active on this date, and for an unlink request the status would transition towards Inactive on this date.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.Status
member.summary: Determines the life cycle status of the client link, for example whether the client link has been accepted or declined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.SuppressNotification
member.summary: Determines whether or not to send email notification of the client link invitation to the primary user of the client account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.LastModifiedDateTime
member.summary: The date and time that the client link was last updated. The value is in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.LastModifiedByUserId
member.summary: The identifier of the last user to update the client link's information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.ForwardCompatibilityMap
member.summary: The list of key and value strings for forward compatibility. This element can be used to avoid otherwise breaking changes when new elements are added in future releases.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Defines the possible status values of a ClientLink.
For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
member.remarks:
See ClientLinkStatus Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632184(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkPending
member.summary: The ClientLink object has been added via the AddClientLinks service operation. The link request has been sent and is pending approval from the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkCanceled
member.summary: The link request has been canceled by the agency.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkExpired
member.summary: The link is inactive due to expiry. The client did not accept or decline the request within 30 days.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkAccepted
member.summary: The invited client should use this value to accept the link invitation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkDeclined
member.summary: The link request has been declined by the invited client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkInProgress
member.summary: The link process is in progress and either waiting for the billing transition to complete or the specified client link start date has not yet arrived.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.Active
member.summary: The link is established and the managing customer can access the client account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkFailed
member.summary: The link process failed to complete successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkRequested
member.summary: The agency should use this value to request an unlink.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkPending
member.summary: A request to terminate the link has been sent. The request is waiting for the system to begin the unlink progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkCanceled
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkInProgress
member.summary: The unlink process is in progress and waiting for the billing transition to complete.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.Inactive
member.summary: The unlink process has completed and the managing customer can no longer access the client account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkFailed
member.summary: The unlink process failed to complete successfully, for example because the billing transition could not be completed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation
member.summary: Defines a user invitation. When the invitation is accepted, the user's Microsoft account is linked to the specified Bing Ads customer accounts. For more information about user authentication, see Managing User Authentication with OAuth.
member.remarks:
See UserInvitation Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn771360(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by SearchUserInvitations and SendUserInvitation service operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation.Id
member.summary: A system generated unique identifier for the user invitation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation.FirstName
member.summary: The first name of the user. The first name is limited to 40 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation.LastName
member.summary: The last name of the user. The last name is limited to 40 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation.Email
member.summary: The email address corresponding to the user's Microsoft account. The address can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation.CustomerId
member.summary: The identifier of the customer this user is invited to manage. The AccountIds element determines which customer accounts the user can manage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation.Role
member.summary: The user role, which determines the level of access that the user has to the accounts specified in the AccountIds element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation.AccountIds
member.summary: An array of identifiers of the accounts that the user can manage. To specify that the user can manage all current and future accounts of the customer to which the user belongs, set to NULL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation.ExpirationDate
member.summary: The date and time that the user invitation will expire. The value is in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserInvitation.Lcid
member.summary: The locale to use when sending correspondence to the user by email or postal mail. The default is EnglishUS.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UserRole
member.summary: Defines the possible roles of a user.
member.remarks:
See UserRole Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee704157(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ICustomerManagementService.GetCustomersInfo(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.GetCustomersInfoRequest)
member.summary:
Gets a list of objects that contain customer identification information, for example the name and identifier of the customer.
The list that this operation returns is based on the customers that the user that you specify in the UserName header element of the request, has access to. If the user is a member of the reseller's user group, the list will contain all customers that the reseller has signed up or a subset of customers if the user is limited to a subset of customers by a user role.
member.remarks: See GetCustomersInfo Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn451282(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of CustomerInfo objects that identifies the list of customers that meet the filter criteria.

member.summary:
Gets a list of objects that contain customer identification information, for example the name and identifier of the customer.
The list that this operation returns is based on the customers that the user that you specify in the UserName header element of the request, has access to. If the user is a member of the reseller's user group, the list will contain all customers that the reseller has signed up or a subset of customers if the user is limited to a subset of customers by a user role.
member.remarks: See GetCustomersInfo Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn451282(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of CustomerInfo objects that identifies the list of customers that meet the filter criteria.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ICustomerManagementService.DeleteAccount(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.DeleteAccountRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes an account.
After deleting the account it will be searchable and show as inactive in the Bing Ads web application. You may or may not choose to surface inactive accounts in your application.
member.remarks: See DeleteAccount Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn451272(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.returns: The response object for this service operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ICustomerManagementService.AddClientLinks(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AddClientLinksRequest)
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Initiates the client link process to manage the account of another customer. Sends an invitation from an agency to a potential client. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
The client account must have a valid payment instrument set up for post-pay billing. Prepaid accounts are not supported for management by agencies.
Only an agency may call this service operation. For more information about becoming an agency, see the Getting started with Bing Ads section of the Agency hub page.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
There is no set limit to the amount of client accounts that can be linked to an agency.
member.remarks: See AddClientLinks Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632187(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The response object for this service operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ICustomerManagementService.AddClientLinksAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AddClientLinksRequest)
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Initiates the client link process to manage the account of another customer. Sends an invitation from an agency to a potential client. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
The client account must have a valid payment instrument set up for post-pay billing. Prepaid accounts are not supported for management by agencies.
Only an agency may call this service operation. For more information about becoming an agency, see the Getting started with Bing Ads section of the Agency hub page.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
There is no set limit to the amount of client accounts that can be linked to an agency.
member.remarks: See AddClientLinks Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632187(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The response object for this service operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ICustomerManagementService.UpdateClientLinks(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UpdateClientLinksRequest)
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Updates the status of the specified client links. To update a client link, the TimeStamp element is required for validation, so you must first call the SearchClientLinks operation to get the existing ClientLink object. Then modify the Status element of the returned ClientLink, and include the updated ClientLink object in a subsequent call to the UpdateClientLinks operation. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
If your user is within an agency, then the operation may be used to update the client link status of any account that you manage or have invited to manage. For more information about becoming an agency, see the Getting started with Bing Ads section of the Agency hub page.
If your user is within a client customer that has one or more accounts managed or invited to be managed by an agency, then you may only use this operation to update the status as LinkAccepted or LinkDeclined. A client may also accept or decline the link request via the Bing Ads web application. For more information, see Accept an agency request.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
There is no set limit to the amount of client accounts that can be linked to an agency.
member.remarks: See UpdateClientLinks Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632185(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The response object for this service operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.ICustomerManagementService.SearchClientLinks(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.SearchClientLinksRequest)
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Searches for the client links for the customer of the current authenticated user, filtered by the search criteria. The operation returns the most recent link for each unique combination of agency customer and client account. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
If your user is within a client customer that has one or more accounts managed by an agency, then you may search one at a time for individual accounts that were or are eligible to be linked. To search by individual account, set the predicate field to ClientAccountId and set the predicate value to the account identifier that you want to find.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
member.remarks: See SearchClientLinks Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632186(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The list of client link invitations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.GetAccountsInfoRequest.CustomerId
member.summary: The identifier of the customer who owns the accounts to get. If not set, the user's credentials are used to determine the customer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.GetAccountsInfoRequest.OnlyParentAccounts
member.summary: Determines whether to return only the accounts that belong to the customer or to also return the accounts that the customer manages for other customers. To return all accounts (those that belong to the customer and those that the customer manages), set this element to false; otherwise, set to true to return account information for only the specified customer. The default is false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.GetCustomersInfoRequest
member.summary:
Gets a list of objects that contain customer identification information, for example the name and identifier of the customer.
The list that this operation returns is based on the customers that the user that you specify in the UserName header element of the request, has access to. If the user is a member of the reseller's user group, the list will contain all customers that the reseller has signed up or a subset of customers if the user is limited to a subset of customers by a user role.
member.remarks:
See GetCustomersInfo Request Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn451282(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by GetCustomersInfo service operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.GetCustomersInfoRequest.CustomerNameFilter
member.summary: A partial or full name of the customers that you want to get. The operation includes the customer in the result if the customer's name begins with the specified filter name. If you do not want to filter by customer name, set this element to an empty string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.GetCustomersInfoRequest.TopN
member.summary: A nonzero positive integer that specifies the number of customers to return in the result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.GetCustomersInfoRequest.ApplicationScope
member.summary: A value that determines whether to return results for advertising customers or publishing customers. If you do not specify the scope, the list may include both types of customers.

member.summary: Constructor for the GetCustomersInfoRequest request object.

A nonzero positive integer that specifies the number of customers to return in the result.
A value that determines whether to return results for advertising customers or publishing customers. If you do not specify the scope, the list may include both types of customers.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.DeleteAccountRequest
member.summary:
Deletes an account.
After deleting the account it will be searchable and show as inactive in the Bing Ads web application. You may or may not choose to surface inactive accounts in your application.
member.remarks:
See DeleteAccount Request Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn451272(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by DeleteAccount service operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.DeleteAccountRequest.AccountId
member.summary: The identifier of the account to delete.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.DeleteAccountRequest.TimeStamp
member.summary: The time-stamp value that the operation uses to reconcile the update. You must call the GetAccount operation to get the time-stamp value. The delete operation fails if the account object has a time-stamp value that differs from the one that you pass.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AddClientLinksRequest
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Initiates the client link process to manage the account of another customer. Sends an invitation from an agency to a potential client. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
The client account must have a valid payment instrument set up for post-pay billing. Prepaid accounts are not supported for management by agencies.
Only an agency may call this service operation. For more information about becoming an agency, see the Getting started with Bing Ads section of the Agency hub page.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
There is no set limit to the amount of client accounts that can be linked to an agency.
member.remarks:
See AddClientLinks Request Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632187(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by AddClientLinks service operation.

member.summary: The list of client links to add.

member.remarks: See AddClientLinksRequest http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632187(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UpdateClientLinksRequest
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Updates the status of the specified client links. To update a client link, the TimeStamp element is required for validation, so you must first call the SearchClientLinks operation to get the existing ClientLink object. Then modify the Status element of the returned ClientLink, and include the updated ClientLink object in a subsequent call to the UpdateClientLinks operation. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
If your user is within an agency, then the operation may be used to update the client link status of any account that you manage or have invited to manage. For more information about becoming an agency, see the Getting started with Bing Ads section of the Agency hub page.
If your user is within a client customer that has one or more accounts managed or invited to be managed by an agency, then you may only use this operation to update the status as LinkAccepted or LinkDeclined. A client may also accept or decline the link request via the Bing Ads web application. For more information, see Accept an agency request.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
There is no set limit to the amount of client accounts that can be linked to an agency.
member.remarks:
See UpdateClientLinks Request Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632185(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by UpdateClientLinks service operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UpdateClientLinksRequest.ClientLinks
member.summary: The list of client links to update.

member.summary: Constructor for the UpdateClientLinksRequest request object.
member.remarks: See UpdateClientLinksRequest http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632185(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.SearchClientLinksRequest
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Searches for the client links for the customer of the current authenticated user, filtered by the search criteria. The operation returns the most recent link for each unique combination of agency customer and client account. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
If your user is within a client customer that has one or more accounts managed by an agency, then you may search one at a time for individual accounts that were or are eligible to be linked. To search by individual account, set the predicate field to ClientAccountId and set the predicate value to the account identifier that you want to find.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
member.remarks:
See SearchClientLinks Request Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632186(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by SearchClientLinks service operation.

member.summary: Determines the request conditions. This operation's response will include client links that match all of the specified predicates.

member.summary: Determines the order of results.

member.summary: Determines the index and size of results per page.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerManagementServiceClient.GetCustomersInfo(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.GetCustomersInfoRequest)
member.summary:
Gets a list of objects that contain customer identification information, for example the name and identifier of the customer.
The list that this operation returns is based on the customers that the user that you specify in the UserName header element of the request, has access to. If the user is a member of the reseller's user group, the list will contain all customers that the reseller has signed up or a subset of customers if the user is limited to a subset of customers by a user role.
member.remarks: See GetCustomersInfo Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn451282(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of CustomerInfo objects that identifies the list of customers that meet the filter criteria.

member.remarks: See GetCustomersInfo Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn451282(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of CustomerInfo objects that identifies the list of customers that meet the filter criteria.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerManagementServiceClient.AddClientLinks(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AddClientLinksRequest)
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Initiates the client link process to manage the account of another customer. Sends an invitation from an agency to a potential client. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
The client account must have a valid payment instrument set up for post-pay billing. Prepaid accounts are not supported for management by agencies.
Only an agency may call this service operation. For more information about becoming an agency, see the Getting started with Bing Ads section of the Agency hub page.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
There is no set limit to the amount of client accounts that can be linked to an agency.
member.remarks: See AddClientLinks Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632187(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The response object for this service operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerManagementServiceClient.AddClientLinksAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.AddClientLinksRequest)
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Initiates the client link process to manage the account of another customer. Sends an invitation from an agency to a potential client. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
The client account must have a valid payment instrument set up for post-pay billing. Prepaid accounts are not supported for management by agencies.
Only an agency may call this service operation. For more information about becoming an agency, see the Getting started with Bing Ads section of the Agency hub page.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
There is no set limit to the amount of client accounts that can be linked to an agency.
member.remarks: See AddClientLinks Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632187(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The response object for this service operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerManagementServiceClient.UpdateClientLinks(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.UpdateClientLinksRequest)
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Updates the status of the specified client links. To update a client link, the TimeStamp element is required for validation, so you must first call the SearchClientLinks operation to get the existing ClientLink object. Then modify the Status element of the returned ClientLink, and include the updated ClientLink object in a subsequent call to the UpdateClientLinks operation. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
If your user is within an agency, then the operation may be used to update the client link status of any account that you manage or have invited to manage. For more information about becoming an agency, see the Getting started with Bing Ads section of the Agency hub page.
If your user is within a client customer that has one or more accounts managed or invited to be managed by an agency, then you may only use this operation to update the status as LinkAccepted or LinkDeclined. A client may also accept or decline the link request via the Bing Ads web application. For more information, see Accept an agency request.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
There is no set limit to the amount of client accounts that can be linked to an agency.
member.remarks: See UpdateClientLinks Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632185(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The response object for this service operation.

member.summary:

Then modify the Status element of the returned ClientLink, and include the updated ClientLink object in a subsequent call to the UpdateClientLinks operation. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
If your user is within an agency, then the operation may be used to update the client link status of any account that you manage or have invited to manage. For more information about becoming an agency, see the Getting started with Bing Ads section of the Agency hub page.
If your user is within a client customer that has one or more accounts managed or invited to be managed by an agency, then you may only use this operation to update the status as LinkAccepted or LinkDeclined. The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
There is no set limit to the amount of client accounts that can be linked to an agency.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerManagementServiceClient.SearchClientLinks(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.SearchClientLinksRequest)
member.summary:
This feature is not supported in sandbox.
Searches for the client links for the customer of the current authenticated user, filtered by the search criteria. The operation returns the most recent link for each unique combination of agency customer and client account. For more information about the client link lifecycle, see Link to Client Accounts.
If your user is within a client customer that has one or more accounts managed by an agency, then you may search one at a time for individual accounts that were or are eligible to be linked. To search by individual account, set the predicate field to ClientAccountId and set the predicate value to the account identifier that you want to find.
The role of the user calling this operation must be Super Admin. For more information, see User Roles and Available Service Operations.
member.remarks: See SearchClientLinks Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn632186(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: The list of client link invitations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.CustomerManagementServiceClient.SendUserInvitation(Microsoft.BingAds.CustomerManagement.SendUserInvitationRequest)
member.summary: Sends an invitation for a Microsoft account user to manage one or more Bing Ads customer accounts. When the invitation is accepted, the user's Microsoft account is linked to the specified Bing Ads customer accounts. For more information about user authentication, see Managing User Authentication with OAuth.
member.remarks: See SendUserInvitation Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn789440(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: A system-generated identifier for the user invitation that was sent.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetOpportunity
member.summary:
Defines an object that contains the suggested budget with estimated clicks and impressions opportunities.
The budget opportunity is an estimate based on the last 15 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks:
See BudgetOpportunity Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh418054(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by GetBudgetOpportunities service operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.Opportunity
member.summary: This is the base class from which opportunity objects derive. The class contains the key used to identify the opportunity and the date by when the opportunity expires.
member.remarks: See Opportunity Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh418063(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.Opportunity.ExpirationDate
member.summary: The date by when the suggested opportunity expires. The dateTime object contains only the date portion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.Opportunity.OpportunityKey
member.summary: An identifier that uniquely identifies the opportunity. You use this identifier when calling the ApplyOpportunites operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetOpportunity.BudgetType
member.summary: The type of budget that the campaign uses.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetOpportunity.CampaignId
member.summary: The identifier of the campaign to which the suggested budget applies.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetOpportunity.CurrentBudget
member.summary: The campaign's current budget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetOpportunity.IncreaseInClicks
member.summary: The estimated clicks opportunities corresponding to the suggested budget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetOpportunity.IncreaseInImpressions
member.summary: The estimated impressions opportunities corresponding to the suggested budget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetOpportunity.PercentageIncreaseInClicks
member.summary: The estimated percentage increase in clicks corresponding to the suggested budget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetOpportunity.PercentageIncreaseInImpressions
member.summary: The estimated percentage increase in impressions corresponding to the suggested budget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetOpportunity.RecommendedBudget
member.summary: The suggested budget based on the last 15 days of performance history for the corresponding campaign.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.CampaignBudgetLandscape
member.summary:
Defines an object that contains a list of budget points for a campaign. You may use the budget points to compare the proposed budgets to your current budget, with the corresponding estimates for impressions, clicks, and cost.
The campaign budget landscape is an estimate based on the last 15 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks:
See CampaignBudgetLandscape Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn434660(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by GetBudgetLandscape service operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.CampaignBudgetLandscape.BaseDate
member.summary: The date when data for budget points were most recently updated by the system.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.CampaignBudgetLandscape.BudgetPoints
member.summary: The list of budget points, including budget point type and budget landscape points.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.CampaignBudgetLandscape.CampaignId
member.summary: The identifier of the campaign corresponding to the list of budget points.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BidOpportunity

member.summary: An indicator of competitive bids for this keyword relative to all search keywords. The competition score ranges from 0 to 1.00, where 0 indicates low competition and 1.00 indicates that there is a high number of advertisers competing for this keyword.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLimitType
member.summary: Defines the possible types of campaign budgets.
member.remarks:
See BudgetLimitType Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh418067(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLimitType.MonthlyBudgetSpendUntilDepleted
member.summary: A monthly budget that is spent until it is depleted. Depending on the activity, the complete budget could be spent in a couple of days, weeks, or not at all.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLimitType.DailyBudgetStandard
member.summary: A daily budget that is spread throughout the day.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLimitType.DailyBudgetAccelerated
member.summary: A daily budget that is spent until it is depleted. Depending on the activity, the complete budget could be spent within a couple of minutes, hours, or not at all.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPoint
member.summary:
Defines an object that contains a budget amount and an estimate of daily impressions, clicks, and cost for this budget amount averaged over the last 15 days. Additionally, the object contains a list of budget landscape points with daily impressions and clicks estimates for the given budget amount during the last 15 days.
The budget point is an estimate based on the last 15 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks:
See BudgetPoint Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn434659(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPoint.BudgetAmount
member.summary: A potential new budget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPoint.BudgetLandscapePoints
member.summary: The list of budget landscape points with daily impressions and clicks estimates for the last 15 days.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPoint.BudgetPointType
member.summary: The type of budget relative to a list of budget points. For example, if the budget point type is Current then this object's BudgetAmount element would be equal to the corresponding campaign's daily budget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPoint.EstimatedAvgDailyClicks
member.summary: The estimated average daily clicks for the given budget amount.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPoint.EstimatedAvgDailyCost
member.summary: The estimated average daily cost for the given budget amount.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPoint.EstimatedAvgDailyImpressions
member.summary: The estimated average daily impressions for the given budget amount.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLandscapePoint
member.summary:
Defines an object that contains daily impressions and clicks estimates for one of the last 15 days.
The budget landscape point is an estimate based on the last 15 days of performance data, and not a prediction or guarantee of future performance.
member.remarks:
See BudgetLandscapePoint Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn434658(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLandscapePoint.BudgetLandscapePointDate
member.summary: Represents one day within the last 15 days.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLandscapePoint.Clicks
member.summary: The real historical campaign clicks performance for the day, if the budget on the corresponding day is equal to your current budget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLandscapePoint.EstimatedClicks
member.summary: The estimated clicks performance for the day , given the provided BudgetAmount element of the BudgetPoint object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLandscapePoint.EstimatedImpressions
member.summary: The estimated impressions performance for the day, given the provided BudgetAmount element of the BudgetPoint object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetLandscapePoint.Impressions
member.summary: The real historical campaign impressions performance for the day, if the budget on the corresponding day is equal to your current budget.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPointType
member.summary: Defines the possible values of a campaign budget point.
member.remarks:
See BudgetPointType Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn434661(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPointType.Current
member.summary: The budget point includes the current budget.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPointType.Suggested
member.summary: The budget point includes the optimal suggested budget. The proposed budget is estimated to yield the optimal ratio of increased clicks to minimal budget increase.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPointType.Maximum
member.summary: The budget point includes the proposed budget which is estimated to yield the maximum number of clicks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.BudgetPointType.Other
member.summary: The budget point includes a proposed budget other than current, maximum, or suggested.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.IOptimizerService.GetBudgetOpportunitiesAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.GetBudgetOpportunitiesRequest)
member.summary: Gets the campaign budget opportunities of the specified account.
member.remarks: See GetBudgetOpportunities Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn376335(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of BudgetOpportunity objects that identify the campaigns whose clicks and impressions may increase if you were to apply the suggested budget. To apply the suggested budget, call the ApplyOpportunities operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.IOptimizerService.GetBudgetLandscape(Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.GetBudgetLandscapeRequest)
member.summary: Gets the campaign budget landscape and corresponding budget points for the specified campaign in an account. You may use the budget points to compare your current budget to any of the proposed budgets.
member.remarks: See GetBudgetLandscape Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn434657(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: A list of CampaignBudgetLandscape objects that identify one or more campaigns with suggested budget points.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.IOptimizerService.GetBudgetLandscapeAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.GetBudgetLandscapeRequest)
member.summary: Gets the campaign budget landscape and corresponding budget points for the specified campaign in an account. You may use the budget points to compare your current budget to any of the proposed budgets.
member.remarks: See GetBudgetLandscape Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn434657(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: A list of CampaignBudgetLandscape objects that identify one or more campaigns with suggested budget points.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.IOptimizerService.GetBidOpportunities(Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.GetBidOpportunitiesRequest)
member.summary:
Gets the keyword bid opportunities of the specified ad group.
Currently bid opportunities are only available in the United States. It is not recommended to use this service operation for accounts in other markets.
member.remarks: See GetBidOpportunities Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn376337(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of BidOpportunity objects that identifies the keywords whose clicks and impressions may increase if you were to apply the suggested match-type bid value. To apply the suggested bid value, call the ApplyOpportunities operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.IOptimizerService.GetBidOpportunitiesAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.GetBidOpportunitiesRequest)
member.summary:
Gets the keyword bid opportunities of the specified ad group.
Currently bid opportunities are only available in the United States. It is not recommended to use this service operation for accounts in other markets.
member.remarks: See GetBidOpportunities Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn376337(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: An array of BidOpportunity objects that identifies the keywords whose clicks and impressions may increase if you were to apply the suggested match-type bid value. To apply the suggested bid value, call the ApplyOpportunities operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.IOptimizerService.GetKeywordOpportunities(Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.GetKeywordOpportunitiesRequest)
member.summary:
Gets a list of keyword suggestions that are relevant to the specified ad group. The keyword suggestion also includes a suggested bid value.
Currently keyword opportunities are only available in the United States. It is not recommended to use this service operation for accounts in other markets.
member.remarks: See GetKeywordOpportunities Service Operation http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn376336(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: A list of KeywordOpportunity objects that identifies a suggested keyword and bid value. The list will be empty if there are no suggestions, which may occur if the ad group does not contain existing ads and keywords.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.IOptimizerService.GetKeywordOpportunitiesAsync(Microsoft.BingAds.Optimizer.GetKeywordOpportunitiesRequest)

member.param: The request object for this service operation.
member.returns: A list of KeywordOpportunity objects that identifies a suggested keyword and bid value. The list will be empty if there are no suggestions, which may occur if the ad group does not contain existing ads and keywords.

See ReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671813(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by SubmitGenerateReport service operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ReportRequest.Format
member.summary: The format of the report data. For example, you can request the data in comma-separated values (Csv) format or tab-separated values (Tsv) format.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ReportRequest.Language
member.summary: The language to use to generate the report headers and columns.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ReportRequest.ReportName
member.summary: The name of the report. The name is included in the report header. If you do not specify a report name, the system generates a name in the form, ReportType-ReportDateTime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ReportRequest.ReturnOnlyCompleteData
member.summary: Determines whether you want the service to generate the report only if all the data has been processed and is available.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines an ad extension by ad report request. Use this report to compare how well different versions of your ad extensions are performing with each ad. You can request impressions, clicks, spend, and average cost per click by ad. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by ad ID, ad title, ad extension type, and ad extension version.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See AdExtensionByAdReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj713606(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportRequest.Aggregation
member.summary: The type of aggregation to use to aggregate the report data. For example, you can aggregate the report data by day or week, or request a summary report.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportRequest.Columns
member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportRequest.Filter
member.summary: The criteria to use to filter the report data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportRequest.Scope
member.summary: The scope of the report. Use this element to limit the report to include data for a combination of accounts, ad groups, and campaigns.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportRequest.Time
member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select a predefined date range, for example, Today or ThisWeek.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines an ad group performance report request. Use this report to more broadly compare delivery performance statistics by ad group, campaign, or account attributes rather than at the keyword level. You can request impressions, impression share (%), clicks, spend, and average cost per click of your ad groups. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by ad group, ad group status, language, and network.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See AdGroupPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671686(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines an ad performance report request. Use this report to help you determine which ads lead to clicks and conversions, and which are not performing. Having underperforming ads in your account can pull down the quality of your campaigns. You can request impressions, clicks, spend, and average cost per click for each ad. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by ad ID, ad status, ad title, display URL, and destination URL.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See AdPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672006(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

You can request component clicks and component click-through rate of your rich ads. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by rich ad subtype, ad title, and component.
This report is available for members of the Rich Search Ads pilot program. This report is available only in the US and Canadian markets.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.BudgetSummaryReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a budget summary report request. Use this report to discover how your campaign's budget is performing for the month. For example, the report shows your monthly budget, how much you have spent to date, and whether you are on target to spend your monthly budget. You can request your monthly budget, how much you have spent to date, and whether you are on target to spend your monthly budget.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See BudgetSummaryReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672028(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportRequest
member.summary:
The GeographicalLocationReportRequest and corresponding programming elements are deprecated, and instead you should use the GeoLocationPerformanceReportRequest.
Defines a geographical location report request. Use this report to see which locations your traffic is coming from. You can then validate whether your location targeting strategy is successful, and identify opportunities to improve. The report also identifies the physical location of the user and the intended geographical location of the user's search query, for example a user in Seattle searching for services in Portland. You can request impressions, clicks, spend, and average cost per click for each ad group, organized by city, country, metro area, radius, state, and account.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See GeographicalLocationReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn393955(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.PublisherUsagePerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a publisher usage performance report request. Use this report to see if any website URLs aren't performing well enough for your campaign or ad group target settings. For example, if ad impressions at those URLs yield a low click-through rate, then you might decide to exclude those websites from your campaign. You can request impressions, clicks, spend, and conversions for websites including the Bing Ads and syndicated search partner networks. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by website URL, account, campaign, and ad group.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See PublisherUsagePerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd797229(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.
