member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a site performance report request. If you bid on website placements, you can use this report to identify website placements that are performing well and those that you may want to exclude from your campaign. Use this information to determine whether any website placements should be excluded from your campaign or ad group target settings. You can request impressions, clicks, spend, and average cost per click for the websites you chose when setting up your ad groups. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by ad group, placement name, website ID, account, and campaign.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See SitePerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd797220(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a search query performance report request. Use this report to see what your audience is searching for when your ads are shown.
You can use this information to make informed additions, removals, or edits to both your keyword and negative keyword lists. You can request impressions, clicks, click-through rate, and average position for search terms that have triggered your ads. For example, if you are a mortgage lender who is running a campaign with the following keywords: mortgage, home mortgage, and home equity loans; and the report shows that the search query "mortgage rates" results in many impressions of your ad, you would probably add "rates" to your keyword list. However, if you do not provide reverse mortgages and the report shows that the search query "reverse mortgage" results in many impressions, you would probably add "reverse mortgage" to your negative keywords list.
The report will include only search terms that resulted in a significant number of clicks in the last 30 days.
Since this data might change over time, please use the KeywordPerformanceReportRequest Data Object to get the performance metrics for your keywords.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See SearchQueryPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee703962(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The type of aggregation to use to aggregate the report data. For example, you can aggregate the report data by day or week, or request a summary report.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportRequest.Columns
member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportRequest.Filter
member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.summary: The scope of the report. Use this element to limit the report to include data for a combination of accounts, ad groups, and campaigns.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportRequest.Time
member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select a predefined date range, for example, Today or ThisWeek.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ConversionPerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a conversion performance report request. Use this report to understand which campaigns and keywords are leading an audience to complete a purchase or other conversion action. You can request conversions, assists, revenue, and revenue per conversion for your campaigns. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by account, ad group, campaign, keyword, and device type.
Available for accounts that are setup to use Bing Ads Campaign Analytics. For more information, see Managing Analytics With Universal Event Tracking (UET).
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.

member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.summary: The scope of the report. For example, you can limit the report to include data for a combination of accounts, ad groups, and campaigns.

member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select a predefined date range, for example, Today or ThisWeek.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GoalsAndFunnelsReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a goals and funnels report request. Use this report to discover whether your audience completes each step through the land, browse, prospect, and conversion pages of your website. For example, you can use this report to determine the step that users leave the conversion funnel, so that you can improve or remove that step to increase the chance that the user will continue to the next step. You can request spend, revenue, assists, conversions, and conversion steps of your websites. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by account, ad group, campaign, keyword, and goal.
Available for accounts that are setup to use Bing Ads Campaign Analytics. For more information, see Managing Analytics With Universal Event Tracking (UET).
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See GoalsAndFunnelsReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg262840(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.NegativeKeywordConflictReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a negative keyword conflict report request. Use this report to discover which keywords and negative keywords are in conflict, and whether the conflict is at the campaign or ad group level. Use this list to figure out which negative keywords to delete. You can request negative keywords that conflict with some of your keywords, and block your ad from showing.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See NegativeKeywordConflictReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh560534(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.NegativeKeywordConflictReportRequest.Scope
member.summary: The scope of the report. Use this element to limit the report to include data for a combination of accounts, ad groups, and campaigns.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchCampaignChangeHistoryReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a change history report request. Use this report to discover when changes to an account were made, as well as which user made the changes. You can request a record of changes made by user and date. For example, you can request a record of changes to campaign name, location target association, and keyword bid. You can request both the old value and new value in the report.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See SearchCampaignChangeHistoryReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh912357(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchCampaignChangeHistoryReportRequest.Scope
member.summary: The scope of the report. Use this element to limit the report to include data for a combination of accounts, ad groups, and campaigns.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchCampaignChangeHistoryReportRequest.Time
member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select one of the following predefined date ranges.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductOfferPerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a product offer performance report request that aggregates the performance data by product offer for a specified time period. You can include details in the report such as impressions, clicks, and spend that you can use to identify product offers that are performing well, and those that are not.
To get performance-based reporting for product offers, the corresponding ad group must contain at least one ProductAd object. For more information about creating product ads, see Creating a Product Ad.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See ProductOfferPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743719(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines an ad extension by keyword report request. Use this report to compare how well different versions of your ad extensions are performing for each keyword. You can request impressions, clicks, spend, and average cost per click of your extensions for each keyword. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by keyword, keyword ID, ad extension type, and ad extension version.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See AdExtensionByKeywordReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj713605(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.summary: The criteria to use to filter the report data.

member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select a predefined date range, for example, Today or ThisWeek.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a campaign performance report request. Use this report to view high-level performance statistics and quality attributes for each campaign or account. This is also a quick way to flag any major campaign or account problems. You can request impressions, impression share (%), clicks, spend, and average cost per click for each campaign or account. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by campaign, campaign status, and quality score.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See CampaignPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671804(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The type of aggregation to use to aggregate the report data. For example, you can aggregate the report data by day or week, or request a summary report.

member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportRequest.Filter
member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportRequest.Scope
member.summary: The scope of the report. Use this element to limit the report to include data for a combination of accounts and campaigns.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportRequest.Time
member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select a predefined date range, for example, Today or ThisWeek.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDetailReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines an ad extension detail report request. Use this report to discover the effectiveness of individual ad extension items, for example, each link of a sitelink extension. You can request impressions, clicks, spend, and average cost per click of individual extension items. This data can be sorted by the individual ad extension display name, ad extension ID, and ad extension type.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See AdExtensionDetailReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn610364(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a share of voice (SOV) report request. Use this report to view impression share (%) of successful bids for each keyword, and identify opportunities to increase impression share. You can request impressions, impression share (%), impression share lost to budget (%), and impression share lost to bid. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by keyword, keyword ID, landing page user experience, and quality score.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See ShareOfVoiceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj592909(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.summary: The scope of the report. Use this element to limit the report to include data for a combination of accounts, ad groups, and campaigns.

member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select a predefined date range, for example, Today or ThisWeek.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductTargetPerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a product target performance report request. Use this report to find out which product targets are performing well and those that are not. You can request impressions, clicks, spend, and average cost per click for your landing pages. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by product target, account, campaign, and ad group.
To get performance-based reporting for product targets, the corresponding ad group must contain at least one ProductAd object. For more information about creating product ads, see Creating a Product Ad.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See ProductTargetPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn195846(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary:
This feature is currently in pilot and will be generally available soon.
Defines a product dimension performance report request that aggregates the performance data by product category, custom label, title, and type for a specified time period. You can include details in the report such as impressions, clicks, and spend that you can use to identify whether or not the Bing Shopping products are performing well.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See ProductDimensionPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn913141(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary:
This feature is currently in pilot and will be generally available soon.
Defines a product partition performance report request that aggregates the performance data by product group and product partition type for a specified time period. You can include details in the report such as impressions, clicks, and spend that you can use to identify whether or not the Bing Shopping products are performing well.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See ProductPartitionPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn913138(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CallDetailReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a call detail report request. Use this report to discover which accounts, campaigns, or ad groups are driving the most completed phone calls. You can request duration and phone spend for each forwarded call that originated from a call ad extension. There is one row or record in the report for each call made to the tracked number.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See CallDetailReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn195845(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The type of aggregation to use to aggregate the report data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CallDetailReportRequest.Columns
member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CallDetailReportRequest.Scope
member.summary: The scope of the report. Use this element to limit the report to include data for specified accounts, campaigns, or ad groups.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CallDetailReportRequest.Time
member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select a predefined date range, for example, Today or LastSevenDays.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDimensionReportRequest
member.summary:
This report request is deprecated and is not supported. Using this data object will throw an exception.
This content is for archive purposes only.
Defines an ad extension dimension report request that lists all versions of an ad extension by account. You may use this information along with the performance data from the AdExtensionByAdReportRequest, AdExtensionByKeywordReportRequest, and AdExtensionDetailReportRequest reports to determine which version performed better.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See AdExtensionDimensionReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj713607(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The criteria to use to filter the report data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDimensionReportRequest.Scope
member.summary: The scope of the report. Use this element to limit the report to include data for one or more accounts.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines an account performance report request. Use this report to observe long-term account performance and trends. You can request impressions, impression share (%), clicks, spend, and average cost per click for individual accounts. Once downloaded, this data can be sorted by individual accounts, currency, bid match type, and delivered match type.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See AccountPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671927(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a tactic and channel report request. Use this report to understand how people interact with your website through the conversion process. You can use this report to get information about which tactic and channel are generating the most revenue and return-on-ad spend. You can request number of times that users reach the different stages of a conversion funnel, broken out by advertising tactic and channel.
Available for accounts that are setup to use Bing Ads Campaign Analytics. For more information, see Managing Analytics With Universal Event Tracking (UET).
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See TacticChannelReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg262842(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportRequest.Aggregation
member.summary: The type of aggregation to use to aggregate the report data. For example, you can aggregate the report data by day or week, or request a summary report.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportRequest.Columns
member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportRequest.Scope
member.summary: The scope of the report. For example, you can limit the report to include data for a combination of accounts, ad groups, and campaigns.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportRequest.Time
member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select a predefined date range, for example, Today or ThisWeek.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportRequest
member.summary:
Defines a geo location performance report request. Use this report to see which locations your traffic is coming from. You can then validate whether your location targeting strategy is successful, and identify opportunities to improve. The report also identifies either the physical location of the search user or the geographical location interest based on the user's search query. You can request impressions, clicks, spend, and average cost per click for each ad group, organized by city, country, metro area, radius, state, and account.
To request a report of this type, pass this object to the SubmitGenerateReport operation.
member.remarks: See GeoLocationPerformanceReportRequest Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743772(v=msads.90).aspx for details.

member.summary: The type of aggregation to use to aggregate the report data. For example, you can aggregate the report data by day or week, or request a summary report.

member.summary: The list of attributes and performance statistics to include in the report. The report will include the columns in the order that you specify them.

member.summary: The filter information to use to filter the report data.

member.summary: The scope of the report. Use this element to limit the report to include data for a combination of accounts, ad groups, and campaigns.

member.summary: The time period to use for the report. You can specify a custom date range or select a predefined date range, for example, Today or ThisWeek.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn
member.summary:
Defines the attributes and performance statistics columns that you can include in the AdExtensionByAdReportRequest.
The attribute columns that you include in a report affects the values within the statistics columns as well as the number or rows. For more information, see Columns that Group the Data.
For a list of columns that you must include, please see the Required Columns section below.
member.remarks:
See AdExtensionByAdReportColumn Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj713608(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AccountName
member.summary: The Name element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.TimePeriod
member.summary: The time period of each report row.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.CampaignName
member.summary: The Name element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.CampaignId
member.summary: The Id element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AdGroupName
member.summary: The Name element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AdGroupId
member.summary: The Id element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AdTitle
member.summary: The Title element of a MobileAd or TextAd.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AdId
member.summary: The Id element of a MobileAd, ProductAd, or TextAd, which is inherited from the Ad base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AdExtensionType
member.summary: The type name that corresponds to the AdExtensionTypeId column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.DeviceOS
member.summary: The operating system of the device specified in the DeviceType column and corresponding to the OSNames element of a DeviceOSTargetBid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.ClickType
member.summary: The ad extension item that the user clicked. For example, the column will contain Driving direction if the user clicked a location ad extension's address.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.TotalClicks
member.summary: The number of billable and non-billable times that the ad extension was clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AdExtensionId
member.summary: The Id element of either the CallAdExtension, LocationAdExtension, ProductAdExtension, or SiteLinksAdExtension, which is inherited from the AdExtension base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AdExtensionVersion
member.summary: The Version element of either the CallAdExtension, LocationAdExtension, ProductAdExtension, or SiteLinksAdExtension, which is inherited from the AdExtension base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AccountNumber
member.summary: The Number element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.AccountId
member.summary: The Id element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.BidMatchType
member.summary: The MatchType element of a Keyword. This can be different from the DeliveredMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad. This can be different from the BidMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.Network
member.summary: The Network element of an AdGroup. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.TopVsOther
member.summary: The report will include a column that indicates whether the ad impression appeared in a top position or elsewhere. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.ExtendedCost
member.summary: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping. The extended costs correspond to the optional taxcost, shippingcost, and nonadvertisingcost parameters of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.RevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByAdReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist
member.summary: The revenue per assist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the criteria to use to filter the ad group performance report data.

See AdGroupPerformanceReportFilter Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671729(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportFilter.AdDistribution
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified distribution medium. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only search ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportFilter.DeviceOS
member.summary: The report will include data where the ad is displayed on the specified device operating systems. For example, you may use the filter to include data for only ads displayed on Windows devices.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportFilter.DeviceType
member.summary: The report will include data where the ad is displayed on the specified device types. For example, you may use the filter to include data for only ads displayed on smartphones.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportFilter.LanguageCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only websites that used the specified languages. For a list of possible values, see Ad Languages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportFilter.Status
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified ad group status values. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only active ad groups.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpm
member.summary: The average of the cost-per-thousand impressions of the ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.PricingModel
member.summary: The PricingModel element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.Language
member.summary: The Language element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceOS
member.summary: The operating system of the device specified in the DeviceType column and corresponding to the OSNames element of a DeviceOSTargetBid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionSharePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads were displayed to users who searched by keywords that matched your keywords and targeting selections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToBudgetPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because of a budget shortfall.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToRankPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your ads ranked too low in the auction. You can improve your competitive position by increasing your bid, improving your quality score, or both.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.QualityScore
member.summary: The numeric score shows you how competitive your ads are in the marketplace by measuring how relevant your keywords and landing pages are to customers' search terms. The quality score is calculated by Bing Ads using the KeywordRelevance, LandingPageRelevance, and LandingPageUserExperience sub scores. If available, the quality score can range from a low of 1 to a high of 10.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.KeywordRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates how likely your ads will be clicked and how well your keyword competes against other keywords targeting the same traffic. This score predicts whether your keyword is likely to lead to a click on your ads, taking into account how well your keyword has performed in the past relative to your ad's position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.LandingPageRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates how relevant your ad and landing page are to the customer's search query or other input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.LandingPageUserExperience
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates whether your landing page is likely to provide a good experience to customers who click your ad and land on your website.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricQualityScore
member.summary: The historic quality score of the keyword. The historic quality score for each row is the value that was calculated for quality score on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricKeywordRelevance
member.summary: The numeric score that indicates the historic relevance of your keyword to the search term. Use the historic keyword relevance score to find out how the keyword relevance score may have changed over time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricLandingPageRelevance
member.summary: The numeric score that indicates the historic relevance of your ad and landing page to the search term. The score for each row is the score that was calculated for landing page relevance on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricLandingPageUserExperience
member.summary: The numeric score that is the aggregate assessment of the historic quality of all landing pages on your site. The score for each row is the score that was calculated for landing page user experience on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToBidPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your bid was too low or your bid and quality score was below minimum thresholds, which prevented you from entering the auction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToLandingPageRelevancePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not due to one or more of the following reasons.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToKeywordRelevancePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your ad copy was not relevant to the user's search query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ManualCalls

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ClickCalls

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.Ptr

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.BidMatchType
member.summary: The MatchType element of a Keyword. This can be different from the DeliveredMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad. This can be different from the BidMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ExtendedCost
member.summary: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping. The extended costs correspond to the optional taxcost, shippingcost, and nonadvertisingcost parameters of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist
member.summary: The revenue per assist.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.BounceRate
member.summary: The percentage of customers to your website that only view one page (the landing page) and then leave your website. In general, you want your bounce rate to be as low as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.TotalVisits
member.summary: The total number of times customers visited your site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePagesPerVisit
member.summary: The average number of pages each customer goes to while on your site. A low number of pages per visit might suggest your website is lacking in design or organization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdGroupPerformanceReportColumn.AverageDurationPerVisit
member.summary: The sum total of the time customers spent browsing your site divided by the number of customers that came to your site.

member.summary: The CurrencyType element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.AdDistribution
member.summary: The AdDistribution element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpm
member.summary: The average of the cost-per-thousand impressions of the ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.PricingModel
member.summary: The PricingModel element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.DestinationUrl
member.summary: The DestinationUrl element of the TextAd, MobileAd, Keyword, or BiddableAdGroupCriterion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.summary: The Language element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.RichAdComponentPerformanceReportColumn.ComponentType
member.summary: The component type of the rich ad that was clicked. For possible values, see ComponentTypeFilter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.RichAdComponentPerformanceReportColumn.ComponentTitle
member.summary: The title of the rich ad component. The ComponentType column identifies the component.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.RichAdComponentPerformanceReportColumn.ComponentDestinationURL
member.summary: The destination URL of the rich ad component.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.RichAdComponentPerformanceReportColumn.ComponentClicks
member.summary: The number of billable clicks of a rich ad. The count includes the first click of a component of the ad and subsequent clicks on the impression if the user waits a short, system-defined interval between clicks. If a subsequent click occurs within the interval, the click may be included in the ComponentNonBillableClicks column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.RichAdComponentPerformanceReportColumn.ComponentNonBillableClicks
member.summary: The number of clicks that occur on different components of the ad after the first click but within the short, system-defined interval. Successive clicks on the same component within the system-defined interval are not counted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.RichAdComponentPerformanceReportColumn.ComponentTotalClicks
member.summary: The number of times that all components of the ad were clicked. This is the sum of the ComponentClicks and ComponentNonBillableClicks columns.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.RichAdComponentPerformanceReportColumn.ComponentCTR
member.summary: The click-through rate of all components of the ad that were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ComponentTypeFilter.Form
member.summary: An entry form on the ad that gathers data from the user. Clicking the button on the form counts as a click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ComponentTypeFilter.Image
member.summary: An image in the ad that contains a hyperlink to a destination URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ComponentTypeFilter.FavoriteIcon

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ComponentTypeFilter.Video

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.RichAdSubTypeFilter.RaisBingShopping

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the criteria to use to filter the keyword performance report data.
member.remarks:
See KeywordPerformanceReportFilter Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672082(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.AdDistribution
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified distribution medium. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only search ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.AdType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified ad types. For example, the report can include data for mobile or text ads. You can specify one or more ad types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.BidMatchType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified bid match types (as opposed to the delivered match type).For example, you can use the filter to include data for ads that were bid on using the exact or phrase match type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified delivered match types (as opposed to the bid match type).For example, you can use the filter to include data for ads that were delivered using the exact or phrase match type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.DeviceType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified types of devices on which the ad is displayed. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only text ads displayed on smartphones.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.KeywordRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates how likely your ads will be clicked and how well your keyword competes against other keywords targeting the same traffic. This score predicts whether your keyword is likely to lead to a click on your ads, taking into account how well your keyword has performed in the past relative to your ad's position. KeywordRelevance is equivalent to the Expected Click-Through Rate label used in the Bing Ads web application. A score of 3 is Above Average; a score of 2 is Average; and a score of 1 is considered Below Average.If you specify a time period that spans multiple days, the score will be the same for each day in the time period, and the value is the most recent calculated score.Note Data for this column is typically updated 14-18 hours after the UTC day ends.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.Keywords
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified keywords. You can specify a maximum of 75 keywords. Each keyword can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.LandingPageRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates whether your landing page is likely to provide a good experience to customers who click your ad and land on your website.LandingPageUserExperience is equivalent to the Landing Page Experience label used in the Bing Ads web application. A score of 2 is Average; and a score of 1 is considered Below Average.If you specify a time period that spans multiple days, the score will be the same for each day in the time period, and the value is the most recent calculated score.Note Data for this column is typically updated 14-18 hours after the UTC day ends.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.LandingPageUserExperience
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates whether your landing page is likely to provide a good experience to customers who click your ad and land on your website.LandingPageUserExperience is equivalent to the Landing Page Experience label used in the Bing Ads web application. A score of 2 is Average; and a score of 1 is considered Below Average.If you specify a time period that spans multiple days, the score will be the same for each day in the time period, and the value is the most recent calculated score.Note Data for this column is typically updated 14-18 hours after the UTC day ends.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.LanguageCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only websites that used the specified languages. For a list of possible values, see Ad Languages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportFilter.QualityScore
member.summary: The report will include data for only keywords with the specified quality scores. You can filter the report based on one or more of the following relevance values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn
member.summary:
Defines the attributes and performance statistics columns that you can include in the KeywordPerformanceReportRequest.
The attribute columns that you include in a report affects the values within the statistics columns as well as the number or rows. For more information, see Columns that Group the Data.
For a list of columns that you must include, please see the Required Columns section below.
member.remarks:
See KeywordPerformanceReportColumn Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672087(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by and data objects.

member.summary: The Name element of an Account.

member.summary: The Number element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AccountId
member.summary: The Id element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.TimePeriod
member.summary: The time period of each report row.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.CampaignName
member.summary: The Name element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.CampaignId
member.summary: The Id element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AdGroupName
member.summary: The Name element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AdGroupId
member.summary: The Id element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Keyword
member.summary: The Text element of a Keyword.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.KeywordId
member.summary: The Id element of a Keyword.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AdId
member.summary: The Id element of a MobileAd, ProductAd, or TextAd, which is inherited from the Ad base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AdType
member.summary: The Type element of a MobileAd, ProductAd, or TextAd, which is inherited from the Ad base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.DestinationUrl
member.summary: The DestinationUrl element of the TextAd, MobileAd, Keyword, or BiddableAdGroupCriterion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.CurrentMaxCpc
member.summary: The maximum cost per click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.CurrencyCode
member.summary: The CurrencyType element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad. This can be different from the BidMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AdDistribution
member.summary: The AdDistribution element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpm
member.summary: The average of the cost-per-thousand impressions of the ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.PricingModel
member.summary: The PricingModel element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.BidMatchType
member.summary: The MatchType element of a Keyword. This can be different from the DeliveredMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.QualityScore
member.summary: The numeric score shows you how competitive your ads are in the marketplace by measuring how relevant your keywords and landing pages are to customers' search terms. The quality score is calculated by Bing Ads using the KeywordRelevance, LandingPageRelevance, and LandingPageUserExperience sub scores. If available, the quality score can range from a low of 1 to a high of 10.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.KeywordRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates how likely your ads will be clicked and how well your keyword competes against other keywords targeting the same traffic. This score predicts whether your keyword is likely to lead to a click on your ads, taking into account how well your keyword has performed in the past relative to your ad's position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.LandingPageRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates how relevant your ad and landing page are to the customer's search query or other input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.LandingPageUserExperience
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates whether your landing page is likely to provide a good experience to customers who click your ad and land on your website.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Language
member.summary: The Language element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricQualityScore
member.summary: The historic quality score of the keyword. The historic quality score for each row is the value that was calculated for quality score on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricKeywordRelevance
member.summary: The numeric score that indicates the historic relevance of your keyword to the search term. Use the historic keyword relevance score to find out how the keyword relevance score may have changed over time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricLandingPageRelevance
member.summary: The numeric score that indicates the historic relevance of your ad and landing page to the search term. The score for each row is the score that was calculated for landing page relevance on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricLandingPageUserExperience
member.summary: The numeric score that is the aggregate assessment of the historic quality of all landing pages on your site. The score for each row is the score that was calculated for landing page user experience on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.KeywordMatchTypeId
member.summary: An identifier that uniquely identifies the keyword and match-type combination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.QualityImpact
member.summary: The numeric score that indicates the possible increase in the number of impressions that the keyword could receive if the corresponding QualityScore column would rise above underperforming.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.BusinessListingId
member.summary: Reserved for internal use.

member.summary: Reserved for internal use.

member.summary: Reserved for internal use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.BusinessCategoryName
member.summary: Reserved for internal use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.CampaignStatus
member.summary: The Status element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AccountStatus
member.summary: The AccountLifeCycleStatus element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AdGroupStatus
member.summary: The Status element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.KeywordStatus
member.summary: The Status element of a Keyword.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Network
member.summary: The Network element of an AdGroup. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.TopVsOther
member.summary: The report will include a column that indicates whether the ad impression appeared in a top position or elsewhere. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceOS
member.summary: The operating system of the device specified in the DeviceType column and corresponding to the OSNames element of a DeviceOSTargetBid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.ExtendedCost
member.summary: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping. The extended costs correspond to the optional taxcost, shippingcost, and nonadvertisingcost parameters of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist
member.summary: The revenue per assist.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.BounceRate
member.summary: The percentage of customers to your website that only view one page (the landing page) and then leave your website. In general, you want your bounce rate to be as low as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.TotalVisits
member.summary: The total number of times customers visited your site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePagesPerVisit
member.summary: The average number of pages each customer goes to while on your site. A low number of pages per visit might suggest your website is lacking in design or organization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.KeywordPerformanceReportColumn.AverageDurationPerVisit
member.summary: The sum total of the time customers spent browsing your site divided by the number of customers that came to your site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.BudgetSummaryReportTimePeriod.LastSevenDays

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.BudgetSummaryReportTimePeriod.ThisMonth
member.summary: A cumulative report for the current calendar month.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.BudgetSummaryReportTimePeriod.LastMonth
member.summary: A cumulative report for the previous calendar month.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AgeGenderDemographicReportColumn.EstimatedImpressionPercent
member.summary: The estimated number of times that an ad could be served to a particular age group or gender, divided by the total number of estimated impressions for all demographics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AgeGenderDemographicReportColumn.EstimatedClickPercent
member.summary: The estimated number of times that an ad will be clicked by a particular age group or gender, divided by the total number of estimated clicks for all demographics.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportFilter
member.summary:
The GeographicalLocationReportRequest and corresponding programming elements are deprecated, and instead you should use the GeoLocationPerformanceReportRequest.
Defines the criteria to use to filter the geographical location report data.
member.remarks:
See GeographicalLocationReportFilter Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn393954(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportFilter.AdDistribution
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified distribution medium. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only search ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportFilter.CountryCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified countries/regions where the user that clicked the ad is located.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportFilter.LanguageCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only websites that used the specified languages. For a list of possible values, see Ad Languages.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn
member.summary:
The GeographicalLocationReportRequest and corresponding programming elements are deprecated, and instead you should use the GeoLocationPerformanceReportRequest.
Defines the attributes and performance statistics columns that you can include in the GeographicalLocationReportRequest.
The attribute columns that you include in a report affects the values within the statistics columns as well as the number or rows. For more information, see Columns that Group the Data.
For a list of columns that you must include, please see the Required Columns section below.
member.remarks:
See GeographicalLocationReportColumn Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn411634(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.AccountName
member.summary: The Name element of an Account.

member.summary: The Number element of an Account.

member.summary: The Id element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.TimePeriod
member.summary: The time period of each report row.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.CampaignName
member.summary: The Name element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.CampaignId
member.summary: The Id element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.AdGroupName
member.summary: The Name element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.AdGroupId
member.summary: The Id element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Country
member.summary: The country used to deliver the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.State
member.summary: The state used to deliver the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.MetroArea
member.summary: The metro area used to deliver the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.CurrencyCode
member.summary: The CurrencyType element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.AdDistribution
member.summary: The AdDistribution element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.AverageCpm
member.summary: The average of the cost-per-thousand impressions of the ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.ProximityTargetLocation
member.summary: The Name element of a RadiusTargetBid. The name of the geographic radius where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Radius
member.summary: The Radius element of a RadiusTargetBid. The geographic radius where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Language
member.summary: The Language element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.City
member.summary: The city used to deliver the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.QueryIntentCountry
member.summary: The name of a country if the user's geographical intent can be determined. The country is set if the user's intent is a country or sub geography of the country, and not necessarily if they are physically located in the country.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.QueryIntentState
member.summary: The name of a state if the user's geographical intent can be determined. The state is set if the user's intent is a state or sub geography of the state, and not necessarily if they are physically located in the state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.QueryIntentCity
member.summary: The name of a city if the user's geographical intent can be determined. The city is set if the user's intent is a city, and not necessarily if they are physically located in the city. For example, the user's search query was rental cars in Portland.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.QueryIntentDMA
member.summary: The name of a metro area if the user's geographical intent can be determined. The metro area is set if the user's intent is a metro area or city within the metro area, and not necessarily if they are physically located in the metro area.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.BidMatchType
member.summary: The MatchType element of a Keyword. This can be different from the DeliveredMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad. This can be different from the BidMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Network
member.summary: The Network element of an AdGroup. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.TopVsOther
member.summary: The report will include a column that indicates whether the ad impression appeared in a top position or elsewhere. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.DeviceOS
member.summary: The operating system of the device specified in the DeviceType column and corresponding to the OSNames element of a DeviceOSTargetBid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.ExtendedCost
member.summary: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping. The extended costs correspond to the optional taxcost, shippingcost, and nonadvertisingcost parameters of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.RevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeographicalLocationReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist
member.summary: The revenue per assist.
