member.remarks:
See PricingModelReportFilter Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn411635(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.PricingModelReportFilter.Cpc
member.summary: The report will include ad groups with a cost per click (CPC) pricing model.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.PricingModelReportFilter.Cpm
member.summary: The report will include ad groups with a cost per thousand impressions (CPM) pricing model.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the criteria to use to filter the website performance report data.
member.remarks:
See SitePerformanceReportFilter Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd796955(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportFilter.AdDistribution
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified distribution medium. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only search ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportFilter.AdType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified ad types. For example, the report can include data for mobile or text ads. You can specify one or more ad types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportFilter.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified delivered match types (as opposed to the bid match type). For example, you can use the filter to include data for ads that were delivered using the exact or phrase match type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportFilter.DeviceType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified types of devices on which the ad is displayed. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only text ads displayed on smartphones.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportFilter.LanguageCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only websites that used the specified languages. For a list of possible values, see Ad Languages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportFilter.SiteIds
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified websites. The list can contain a maximum of 300 identifiers.

member.summary: The URL of the website that displayed the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.SiteId
member.summary: The Id element of a SitePlacement.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.AdId
member.summary: The Id element of a MobileAd, ProductAd, or TextAd, which is inherited from the Ad base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.DestinationUrl
member.summary: The DestinationUrl element of the TextAd, MobileAd, Keyword, or BiddableAdGroupCriterion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.CurrentMaxCpc
member.summary: The maximum cost per click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.CurrencyCode
member.summary: The CurrencyType element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad. This can be different from the BidMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.AdDistribution
member.summary: The AdDistribution element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.AdType
member.summary: The Type element of a MobileAd, ProductAd, or TextAd, which is inherited from the Ad base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpm
member.summary: The average of the cost-per-thousand impressions of the ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SitePerformanceReportColumn.PricingModel
member.summary: The PricingModel element of an AdGroup.

member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.summary: The Language element of an AdGroup.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the criteria to use to filter the search query performance report data.
member.remarks:
See SearchQueryPerformanceReportFilter Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee703961(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportFilter.AdStatus
member.summary: The report will include data for ads that have the specified status value. You can specify one or more status values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportFilter.AdType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified ad types. For example, the report can include data for mobile or text ads. You can specify one or more ad types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportFilter.CampaignStatus
member.summary: The report will include data for campaigns that have the specified status value. You can specify one or more status values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportFilter.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified delivered match types (as opposed to the bid match type). For example, you can use the filter to include data for ads that were delivered using the exact or phrase match type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportFilter.ExcludeZeroClicks
member.summary: If the value of this element is set to true, search terms that had one or more ad impressions but resulted in zero clicks in the specified time duration will be excluded from the report.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportFilter.LanguageCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only websites that used the specified languages. For a list of possible values, see Ad Languages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportFilter.SearchQueries
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified search query strings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryReportAggregation.Summary
member.summary: The report data will be aggregated for the entire specified report time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryReportAggregation.Hourly
member.summary: The report data will be aggregated for each hour.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryReportAggregation.Daily
member.summary: The report data will be aggregated for each day.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryReportAggregation.Weekly
member.summary: The report data will be aggregated for each week.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryReportAggregation.Monthly
member.summary: The report data will be aggregated for each month.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryReportAggregation.Yearly
member.summary: The report data will be aggregated for each year.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryReportAggregation.HourOfDay
member.summary: The report data will be aggregated by each of the 24 hours in a day.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryReportAggregation.DayOfWeek
member.summary: The report data will be aggregated by each of the seven days in a week.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.SearchQueryPerformanceReportColumn
member.summary:
Defines the attributes and performance statistics columns that you can include in the SearchQueryPerformanceReportRequest.
The report will include data only for search terms that resulted in a significant number of clicks in the last 30 days.
Since this data might change over time, please use the Keyword Performance Report to get the performance metrics for your keywords.
The attribute columns that you include in a report affects the values within the statistics columns as well as the number or rows. For more information, see Columns that Group the Data.
For a list of columns that you must include, please see the Required Columns section below.
member.remarks:
See SearchQueryPerformanceReportColumn Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee703958(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdStatusReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the ad status values that you can use to filter the report data. These values are also used as column values in reports that include ad status, such as the search query performance report.
member.remarks:
See AdStatusReportFilter Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh560533(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdStatusReportFilter.Submitted
member.summary: The same meaning as Active. This value is maintained for backward compatibility; however, you should use Active instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdStatusReportFilter.Rejected
member.summary: The report will contain ads that have been rejected by editorial review.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdStatusReportFilter.Deleted
member.summary: The report will contain ads that have been deleted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdStatusReportFilter.Pending
member.summary: The report will contain ads that are pending editorial review.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdStatusReportFilter.Active
member.summary: The report will contain ads that are active.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignStatusReportFilter

See CampaignStatusReportFilter Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672004(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by and data objects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignStatusReportFilter.Submitted
member.summary: The same meaning as Active. This value is maintained for backward compatibility; however, you should use Active instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignStatusReportFilter.Cancelled
member.summary: The report will contain campaigns that have been canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignStatusReportFilter.Deleted
member.summary: The report will contain campaigns that have been deleted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignStatusReportFilter.Paused
member.summary: The report will contain campaigns that are paused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignStatusReportFilter.BudgetPaused
member.summary: The report will contain campaigns that are paused due to budget restrictions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignStatusReportFilter.Active
member.summary: The report will contain campaigns that are active.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ConversionPerformanceReportFilter.DeviceType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified types of devices on which the ad is displayed. For example, you can use the filter to include data only for text ads displayed on smartphones.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ConversionPerformanceReportFilter.Keywords
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified keywords. You can specify a maximum of 75 keywords. Each keyword can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GoalsAndFunnelsReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GoalsAndFunnelsReportColumn.FunnelConversionRate
member.summary: The funnel conversion rate is the percent of conversions completed by users who at minimum visited the webpage corresponding to step 1 of your goal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GoalsAndFunnelsReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GoalsAndFunnelsReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GoalsAndFunnelsReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GoalsAndFunnelsReportColumn.ExtendedCost
member.summary: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping. The extended costs correspond to the optional taxcost, shippingcost, and nonadvertisingcost parameters of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GoalsAndFunnelsReportColumn.GoalId
member.summary: This is a unique ID that identifies the goal.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TrafficSourcesReportFilter.GoalIds

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the criteria to use to filter the ad dynamic text performance report data.
member.remarks:
See AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportFilter Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb672086(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportFilter.AdDistribution
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified distribution medium. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only search ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportFilter.AdType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified ad types. For example, the report can include data for mobile or text ads. You can specify one or more ad types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportFilter.DeviceType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified types of devices on which the ad is displayed. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only text ads displayed on smartphones.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportFilter.LanguageCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only websites that used the specified languages. For a list of possible values, see Ad Languages.

member.summary: The Text element of a Keyword.

member.summary: The Title element of a MobileAd or TextAd.

member.summary: The Type element of a MobileAd, ProductAd, or TextAd, which is inherited from the Ad base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.DestinationUrl
member.summary: The DestinationUrl element of the TextAd, MobileAd, Keyword, or BiddableAdGroupCriterion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.Param1
member.summary: The Param1 element of a Keyword or BiddableAdGroupCriterion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.Param2
member.summary: The Param2 element of a Keyword or BiddableAdGroupCriterion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.Param3
member.summary: The Param3 element of a Keyword or BiddableAdGroupCriterion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.CurrencyCode
member.summary: The CurrencyType element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.AdDistribution
member.summary: The AdDistribution element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpm
member.summary: The average of the cost-per-thousand impressions of the ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.PricingModel
member.summary: The PricingModel element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdDynamicTextPerformanceReportColumn.Language
member.summary: The Language element of an AdGroup.

member.summary: The Name element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.AdGroupId
member.summary: The Id element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.Keyword
member.summary: The Text element of a Keyword.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.KeywordId
member.summary: The Id element of a Keyword.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.AdExtensionType
member.summary: The type name that corresponds to the AdExtensionTypeId column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.DeviceOS
member.summary: The operating system of the device specified in the DeviceType column and corresponding to the OSNames element of a DeviceOSTargetBid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.ClickType
member.summary: The ad extension item that the user clicked. For example, the column will contain Driving direction if the user clicked a location ad extension's address.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.TotalClicks
member.summary: The number of billable and non-billable times that the ad extension was clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.AdExtensionId
member.summary: The Id element of either the CallAdExtension, LocationAdExtension, ProductAdExtension, or SiteLinksAdExtension, which is inherited from the AdExtension base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.AdExtensionVersion
member.summary: The Version element of either the CallAdExtension, LocationAdExtension, ProductAdExtension, or SiteLinksAdExtension, which is inherited from the AdExtension base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.AccountNumber
member.summary: The Number element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.AccountId
member.summary: The Id element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.BidMatchType
member.summary: The MatchType element of a Keyword. This can be different from the DeliveredMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad. This can be different from the BidMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.Network
member.summary: The Network element of an AdGroup. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.TopVsOther
member.summary: The report will include a column that indicates whether the ad impression appeared in a top position or elsewhere. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.ExtendedCost
member.summary: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping. The extended costs correspond to the optional taxcost, shippingcost, and nonadvertisingcost parameters of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.RevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionByKeywordReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist
member.summary: The revenue per assist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the criteria to use to filter the campaign performance report data.
member.remarks:
See CampaignPerformanceReportFilter Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671808(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter.AdDistribution
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified distribution medium. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only search ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter.DeviceOS
member.summary: The report will include data where the ad is displayed on the specified device operating systems. For example, you may use the filter to include data for only ads displayed on Windows devices.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter.DeviceType
member.summary: The report will include data where the ad is displayed on the specified device types. For example, you may use the filter to include data for only ads displayed on smartphones.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter.Status
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified ad group status values. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only active ad groups.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn
member.summary:
Defines the attributes and performance statistics columns that you can include in the CampaignPerformanceReportRequest.
The attribute columns that you include in a report affects the values within the statistics columns as well as the number or rows. For more information, see Columns that Group the Data.
For a list of columns that you must include, please see the Required Columns section below.
member.remarks:
See CampaignPerformanceReportColumn Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb671614(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityClicks
member.summary: The number of low-quality clicks. Low-quality clicks are clicks that exhibit a low likelihood of commercial intent and for which customers are not billed. The following are some of the reasons that a click can be considered of low quality:

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityClicksPercent
member.summary: The low-quality clicks as a percentage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityImpressions
member.summary: The number of impressions that result from low-quality keyword searches.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityImpressionsPercent
member.summary: The low-quality impressions as a percentage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityConversions
member.summary: The number of conversions that originate from low-quality clicks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityConversionRate
member.summary: The low-quality conversion rate as a percentage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpm
member.summary: The average of the cost-per-thousand impressions of the ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceOS
member.summary: The operating system of the device specified in the DeviceType column and corresponding to the OSNames element of a DeviceOSTargetBid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionSharePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads were displayed to users who searched by keywords that matched your keywords and targeting selections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToBudgetPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because of a budget shortfall.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToRankPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your ads ranked too low in the auction. You can improve your competitive position by increasing your bid, improving your quality score, or both.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.QualityScore
member.summary: The numeric score shows you how competitive your ads are in the marketplace by measuring how relevant your keywords and landing pages are to customers' search terms. The quality score is calculated by Bing Ads using the KeywordRelevance, LandingPageRelevance, and LandingPageUserExperience sub scores. If available, the quality score can range from a low of 1 to a high of 10.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.KeywordRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates how likely your ads will be clicked and how well your keyword competes against other keywords targeting the same traffic. This score predicts whether your keyword is likely to lead to a click on your ads, taking into account how well your keyword has performed in the past relative to your ad's position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LandingPageRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates how relevant your ad and landing page are to the customer's search query or other input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LandingPageUserExperience
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates whether your landing page is likely to provide a good experience to customers who click your ad and land on your website.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricQualityScore
member.summary: The historic quality score of the keyword. The historic quality score for each row is the value that was calculated for quality score on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricKeywordRelevance
member.summary: The numeric score that indicates the historic relevance of your keyword to the search term. Use the historic keyword relevance score to find out how the keyword relevance score may have changed over time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricLandingPageRelevance
member.summary: The numeric score that indicates the historic relevance of your ad and landing page to the search term. The score for each row is the score that was calculated for landing page relevance on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricLandingPageUserExperience
member.summary: The numeric score that is the aggregate assessment of the historic quality of all landing pages on your site. The score for each row is the score that was calculated for landing page user experience on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToBidPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your bid was too low or your bid and quality score was below minimum thresholds, which prevented you from entering the auction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToLandingPageRelevancePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not due to one or more of the following reasons.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToKeywordRelevancePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your ad copy was not relevant to the user's search query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.PhoneImpressions
member.summary: The number of times your tracked number was shown on all devices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.PhoneCalls
member.summary: The number of total calls to the tracked phone number that showed with your ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ManualCalls
member.summary: The number of calls dialed manually from any device to the tracked phone number.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ClickCalls
member.summary: The number of phone calls initiated by clicks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Ptr
member.summary: The phone-through rate (Ptr).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.PhoneSpend
member.summary: The total cost for completed calls to your tracked number.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpp
member.summary: The average cost per phone call (CPP).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.TotalCostPhoneAndClicks
member.summary: The total cost for cost for click spend and phone call spend combined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Network
member.summary: The Network element of an AdGroup. The following is a list of possible values.

member.summary: The report will include a column that indicates whether the ad impression appeared in a top position or elsewhere. The following is a list of possible values.

member.summary: The MatchType element of a Keyword. This can be different from the DeliveredMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist
member.summary: The revenue per assist.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.BounceRate
member.summary: The percentage of customers to your website that only view one page (the landing page) and then leave your website. In general, you want your bounce rate to be as low as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.TotalVisits
member.summary: The total number of times customers visited your site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePagesPerVisit
member.summary: The average number of pages each customer goes to while on your site. A low number of pages per visit might suggest your website is lacking in design or organization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AverageDurationPerVisit
member.summary: The sum total of the time customers spent browsing your site divided by the number of customers that came to your site.

member.summary: The report will include a column that indicates whether the ad impression appeared in a top position or elsewhere. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDetailReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDetailReportColumn.ExtendedCost
member.summary: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping. The extended costs correspond to the optional taxcost, shippingcost, and nonadvertisingcost parameters of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDetailReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDetailReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDetailReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDetailReportColumn.RevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AdExtensionDetailReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist
member.summary: The revenue per assist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the criteria to use to filter the share of voice report data.
member.remarks:
See ShareOfVoiceReportFilter Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj592908(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportFilter.AdDistribution
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified distribution medium. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only search ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportFilter.BidMatchType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified bid match types (as opposed to the delivered match type).For example, you can use the filter to include data for ads that were bid on using the exact or phrase match type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportFilter.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified delivered match types (as opposed to the bid match type).For example, you can use the filter to include data for ads that were delivered using the exact or phrase match type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportFilter.Keywords
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified keywords. You can specify a maximum of 75 keywords. Each keyword can contain a maximum of 100 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportFilter.LanguageCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only websites that used the specified languages. For a list of possible values, see Ad Languages.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn
member.summary:
Defines the attributes and performance statistics columns that you can include in the ShareOfVoicePerformanceReportRequest.
The attribute columns that you include in a report affects the values within the statistics columns as well as the number or rows. For more information, see Columns that Group the Data.
For a list of columns that you must include, please see the Required Columns section below.
member.remarks:
See ShareOfVoiceReportColumn Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj592910(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.AccountName
member.summary: The Name element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.TimePeriod
member.summary: The time period of each report row.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.CampaignName
member.summary: The Name element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.AdGroupName
member.summary: The Name element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.Keyword
member.summary: The Text element of a Keyword.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad. This can be different from the BidMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.BidMatchType
member.summary: The MatchType element of a Keyword. This can be different from the DeliveredMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.Language
member.summary: The Language element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.AccountNumber
member.summary: The Number element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.AccountId
member.summary: The Id element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.KeywordId
member.summary: The Id element of a Keyword.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.AdGroupId
member.summary: The Id element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.CampaignId
member.summary: The Id element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.ImpressionSharePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads were displayed to users who searched by keywords that matched your keywords and targeting selections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToBudgetPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because of a budget shortfall.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToRankPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your ads ranked too low in the auction. You can improve your competitive position by increasing your bid, improving your quality score, or both.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToLandingPageRelevancePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not due to one or more of the following reasons.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToKeywordRelevancePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your ad copy was not relevant to the user's search query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToBidPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your bid was too low or your bid and quality score was below minimum thresholds, which prevented you from entering the auction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.CurrentMaxCpc
member.summary: The maximum cost per click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.QualityScore
member.summary: The numeric score shows you how competitive your ads are in the marketplace by measuring how relevant your keywords and landing pages are to customers' search terms. The quality score is calculated by Bing Ads using the KeywordRelevance, LandingPageRelevance, and LandingPageUserExperience sub scores. If available, the quality score can range from a low of 1 to a high of 10.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.KeywordRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates how likely your ads will be clicked and how well your keyword competes against other keywords targeting the same traffic. This score predicts whether your keyword is likely to lead to a click on your ads, taking into account how well your keyword has performed in the past relative to your ad's position.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.LandingPageRelevance
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates how relevant your ad and landing page are to the customer's search query or other input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.LandingPageUserExperience
member.summary: A numeric score that indicates whether your landing page is likely to provide a good experience to customers who click your ad and land on your website.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ShareOfVoiceReportColumn.AdDistribution
member.summary: The AdDistribution element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.AdGroupCriterionId
member.summary: The Id element of the corresponding AdGroupCriterion, or product group in the context of a Bing Shopping campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.PartitionType
member.summary: The PartitionType element of a ProductPartition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.AdId
member.summary: The Id element of a MobileAd, ProductAd, or TextAd, which is inherited from the Ad base object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.CurrentMaxCpc
member.summary: The maximum cost per click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.CurrencyCode
member.summary: The CurrencyType element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad. This can be different from the BidMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.BidMatchType
member.summary: The MatchType element of a Keyword. This can be different from the DeliveredMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.Language
member.summary: The Language element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.CampaignStatus
member.summary: The Status element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.AccountStatus
member.summary: The AccountLifeCycleStatus element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.AdGroupStatus
member.summary: The Status element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.DestinationUrl
member.summary: The DestinationUrl element of the TextAd, MobileAd, Keyword, or BiddableAdGroupCriterion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.Network
member.summary: The Network element of an AdGroup. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.TopVsOther
member.summary: The report will include a column that indicates whether the ad impression appeared in a top position or elsewhere. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.ExtendedCost
member.summary: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping. The extended costs correspond to the optional taxcost, shippingcost, and nonadvertisingcost parameters of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ProductPartitionPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist
member.summary: The revenue per assist.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityClicks
member.summary: The number of low-quality clicks. Low-quality clicks are clicks that exhibit a low likelihood of commercial intent and for which customers are not billed. The following are some of the reasons that a click can be considered of low quality:

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityClicksPercent
member.summary: The low-quality clicks as a percentage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityImpressions
member.summary: The number of impressions that result from low-quality keyword searches.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityImpressionsPercent
member.summary: The low-quality impressions as a percentage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityConversions
member.summary: The number of conversions that originate from low-quality clicks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityConversionRate
member.summary: The low-quality conversion rate as a percentage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpm
member.summary: The average of the cost-per-thousand impressions of the ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceOS
member.summary: The operating system of the device specified in the DeviceType column and corresponding to the OSNames element of a DeviceOSTargetBid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionSharePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads were displayed to users who searched by keywords that matched your keywords and targeting selections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToBudgetPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because of a budget shortfall.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToRankPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your ads ranked too low in the auction. You can improve your competitive position by increasing your bid, improving your quality score, or both.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToBidPercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your bid was too low or your bid and quality score was below minimum thresholds, which prevented you from entering the auction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToLandingPageRelevancePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not due to one or more of the following reasons.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToKeywordRelevancePercent
member.summary: The percentage of time your ads would have been displayed to users, but were not because your ad copy was not relevant to the user's search query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.PhoneImpressions
member.summary: The number of times your tracked number was shown on all devices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.PhoneCalls
member.summary: The number of total calls to the tracked phone number that showed with your ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.ManualCalls

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.ClickCalls

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.BounceRate
member.summary: The percentage of customers to your website that only view one page (the landing page) and then leave your website. In general, you want your bounce rate to be as low as possible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.TotalVisits
member.summary: The total number of times customers visited your site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePagesPerVisit
member.summary: The average number of pages each customer goes to while on your site. A low number of pages per visit might suggest your website is lacking in design or organization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.AccountPerformanceReportColumn.AverageDurationPerVisit
member.summary: The sum total of the time customers spent browsing your site divided by the number of customers that came to your site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.ThirdPartyAdGroup
member.summary: The name of the ad group that you defined on a paid search provider other than Bing Ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.ThirdPartyTerm
member.summary: The keyword to track that you defined on a paid search provider other than Bing Ads.

member.summary: The Name element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.CampaignId
member.summary: The Id element of a Campaign.

member.summary: The Name element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.AdGroupId
member.summary: The Id element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Keyword
member.summary: The Text element of a Keyword.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.KeywordId
member.summary: The Id element of a Keyword.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Goal
member.summary: The name of your event tracking or campaign analytics goal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Step1Count
member.summary: The number of times that a user entered step 1 of the funnel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Step2Count
member.summary: The number of times that a user entered step 2 of the funnel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Step3Count
member.summary: The number of times that a user entered step 3 of the funnel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Step4Count
member.summary: The number of times that a user entered step 4 of the funnel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Step5Count
member.summary: The number of times that a user entered step 5 of the funnel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.FunnelConversionRate
member.summary: The funnel conversion rate is the percent of conversions completed by users who at minimum visited the webpage corresponding to step 1 of your goal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.TacticChannelReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the criteria to use to filter the geographical location performance report data.
member.remarks:
See GeoLocationPerformanceReportFilter Data Object http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743754(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportFilter.AdDistribution
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified distribution medium. For example, you can use the filter to include data for only search ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportFilter.CountryCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified countries/regions where the user that clicked the ad is located.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportFilter.LanguageCode
member.summary: The report will include data for only websites that used the specified languages. For a list of possible values, see Ad Languages.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn
member.summary:
Defines the attributes and performance statistics columns that you can include in the GeoLocationPerformanceReportRequest.
The attribute columns that you include in a report affects the values within the statistics columns as well as the number or rows. For more information, see Columns that Group the Data.
For a list of columns that you must include, please see the Required Columns section below.
member.remarks:
See GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn Value Set http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn743762(v=msads.90).aspx for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.AccountName
member.summary: The Name element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.AccountNumber
member.summary: The Number element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.AccountId
member.summary: The Id element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.TimePeriod
member.summary: The time period of each report row.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.CampaignName
member.summary: The Name element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.CampaignId
member.summary: The Id element of a Campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.AdGroupName
member.summary: The Name element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.AdGroupId
member.summary: The Id element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Country
member.summary: The country used to deliver the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.State
member.summary: The state used to deliver the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.MetroArea
member.summary: The metro area used to deliver the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.City
member.summary: The city used to deliver the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.CurrencyCode
member.summary: The CurrencyType element of an Account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.AdDistribution
member.summary: The AdDistribution element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages. Without impressions there are no clicks or conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: The number of times that the ads in the account were clicked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions). For example, if your ads got 50 clicks given 2,348 impressions, your CTR is 2.13 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpc
member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks. This is the average amount you're actually charged each time your ad is clicked. For example, if you paid a total of 48.35 for 300 clicks, your average CPC is 0.16.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Spend
member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.AverageCpm
member.summary: The average of the cost-per-thousand impressions of the ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.ProximityTargetLocation
member.summary: The Name element of a RadiusTargetBid. The name of the geographic radius where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Radius
member.summary: The Radius element of a RadiusTargetBid. The geographic radius where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Language
member.summary: The Language element of an AdGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.BidMatchType
member.summary: The MatchType element of a Keyword. This can be different from the DeliveredMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad. This can be different from the BidMatchType column, for example if you bid on a broad match and the search term was an exact match. For more information, see Match Type and Bid Values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Network
member.summary: The Network element of an AdGroup. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.TopVsOther
member.summary: The report will include a column that indicates whether the ad impression appeared in a top position or elsewhere. The following is a list of possible values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The DeviceName element of a DeviceOSTargetBid. The type of device which showed ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceOS
member.summary: The operating system of the device specified in the DeviceType column and corresponding to the OSNames element of a DeviceOSTargetBid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad. The action could be purchasing your product, registering for your webinar, joining an organization, or whatever you consider your goal and best measure of the ad's success.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage. The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks. For example, if the ads in your campaign got 300 clicks and four conversions, the conversion rate is 1.33 (%).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.ExtendedCost
member.summary: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping. The extended costs correspond to the optional taxcost, shippingcost, and nonadvertisingcost parameters of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions. Corresponds to the optional revenue parameter of a Bing Ads campaign analytics tracking script.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion. The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.RevenuePerAssist
member.summary: The revenue per assist.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.LocationType
member.summary: The location type used to deliver ads. For example to distinguish between people in versus searching for or viewing pages about the corresponding location of interest.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.GeoLocationPerformanceReportColumn.MostSpecificLocation
member.summary: The most specific location used to deliver ads. For example if the City and Country columns are both identified, this column will include the same value as the City column.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ApiFaultDetail.BatchErrors
member.summary: An array of BatchError objects that identifies the items in the batch of items in the request message that caused the operation to fail. Each object contains the details that explain why the item caused the failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.Reporting.ApiFaultDetail.OperationErrors

member.returns: Contains the status of the report request and the download URL.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.AuthorizationData
member.summary: Represents a user who intends to access the corresponding customer and account. An instance of this class is required to authenticate with Bing Ads if you are using either or .

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AuthorizationData.Authentication
member.summary: An object representing the authentication method that should be used in calls to the Bing Ads web services.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AuthorizationData.AccountId
member.summary: The identifier of the account that owns the entities in the request. Used as the CustomerAccountId header and the AccountId body elements in calls to the Bing Ads web services.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AuthorizationData.CustomerId
member.summary: The identifier of the customer that owns the account. Used as the CustomerId header element in calls to the Bing Ads web services.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.AuthorizationData.DeveloperToken
member.summary: The Bing Ads developer access token. Used as the DeveloperToken header element in calls to the Bing Ads web services.
